CVE-2024-4603(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-21T21:35:02

3 posts

Issue summary: Checking excessively long DSA keys or parameters may be very slow. Impact summary: Applications that use the functions EVP_PKEY_param_check() or EVP_PKEY_public_check() to check a DSA public key or DSA parameters may experience long delays. Where the key or parameters that are being checked have been obtained from an untrusted source this may lead to a Denial of Service. The funct

alpinelinux@fosstodon.org at 2024-06-18T19:47:49.000Z ##

Also released: Alpine Linux 3.17.8, 3.18.7 and 3.19.2.

Those releases contains various security fixes including fixes for:

OpenSSL

- CVE-2024-2511
- CVE-2024-4603

busybox

- CVE-2023-42363
- CVE-2023-42364
- CVE-2023-42365
- CVE-2023-42366

See: https://alpinelinux.org/posts/Alpine-3.17.8-3.18.7-3.19.2-released.html

harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-09T12:21:26.000Z ##

@chainq @68000 We also release hotfix updates to our "openssl3.library" as needed. However none of the recent vulnerabilities (including CVE-2024-4741 and CVE-2024-4603) warranted a hotfix release as these issues can only occur if a local application uses the affected functionalities. Any security updates to MorphOS openssl3.library are announced at https://www.morphos-team.net/news and https://morph.zone/news/

##
bedast@squirrelmob.com at 2024-06-15T14:52:21.000Z ##

Microsoft got Recall very wrong. And itâs good that theyâre putting it on hold to rethink and rework it.

But I donât think they learned how wrong âneeds physical accessâ is these days.

Never mind the various phishing scams out there that has vulnerable users granting remote access to scammers. CVE-2024-30078 shows us that gaining control is still possible today without any user involvement.

This CVE is a vulnerability in Windows 11 Wifi, where an attacker can gain access to the computer and execute whatever they want without a login of any kind, and without the user doing anything. A threat actor could retrieve whatever data they wanted, probably with a decent amount of throughput with modern Wifi.

Now, Microsoft has already released an update to patch this (UPDATE NOW IF YOU RUN WINDOWS) so you can stop this, specific attack. But what about future vectors? What about people who donât patch? What about people that wait for the next scheduled update?

And, again, Apple has their own version of Recall called Apple Intelligence, and the security community needs to start poking holes into that as well. Apple isnât immune to this either. Apple seems to be putting more thought into privacy and security, but itâs yet to be proven.

#Microsoft #Copilot #Recall #Apple #Intelligence #AppleIntelligence #Privacy #Security

##
LukaszOlejnik@mastodon.social at 2024-06-15T04:49:32.000Z ##

Critical bug in Windows systems. It is possible to take control of the system via Wi-Fi. The user does not have to do anything. All he needs is for someone within range of his wifi to want to hack him. The attack is simple, repeatable, reliable. https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-30078

##

CVE-2024-4577
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.01%

updated 2024-06-21T19:15:30.620000

68 posts

In PHP versionsÂ 8.1.* before 8.1.29, 8.2.* before 8.2.20, 8.3.* before 8.3.8, when using Apache and PHP-CGI on Windows, if the system is set up to use certain code pages, Windows may use "Best-Fit" behavior to replace characters in command line given toÂ Win32 API functions. PHP CGI module may misinterpret those characters as PHP options, which may allow a malicious user to pass options to PHP bina

Nuclei template

jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-06-20T14:00:09.000Z ##

ï½¢ The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-4577 and carrying a severity rating of 9.8 out of 10, stems from errors in the way PHP converts Unicode characters into ASCII. A feature built into Windows known as Best Fit allows attackers to use a technique known as argument injection to convert user-supplied input into characters that pass malicious commands to the main PHP application ï½£

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/06/thousands-of-servers-infected-with-ransomware-via-critical-php-vulnerability/

malware_traffic at 2024-06-12T23:47:39.152Z ##

2024-06-11 (Tuesday): I saw a single probe for CVE-2024-4577 from 221.122.67[.]75 using the "auto_prepend_file" method hit an Ubuntu Apache web server I'm currently running. I saved a sanitized example of the traffic in a #pcap available at: https://malware-traffic-analysis.net/2024/06/11/index.html

#CVE20244577
#CVE_2024_4577

This is a vulnerability against outdated versions of PHP for Windows that was publicly announced on 2024-06-06.

A quick write-up from my employer is available at: https://github.com/PaloAltoNetworks/Unit42-timely-threat-intel/blob/main/2024-06-11-CVE-2024-4577.txt

Or you could just search for the vulnerability on your own, since there's been a lot of discussion about it lately.

##
youranonriots@kolektiva.social at 2024-06-12T00:39:29.000Z ##

2024-06-11 (Tuesday): Our telemetry reveals ongoing exploitation attempts of #CVE20244577 in #PHP on Windows. Our customers are protected from these exploits including the "auto_append_file" method. More information we found on this vulnerability at https://bit.ly/4ekJJjx

##
ks982579@techhub.social at 2024-06-08T13:55:32.000Z ##

A new critical security flaw (CVE-2024-4577) affecting all versions of PHP on Windows has been disclosed. This CGI argument injection vulnerability allows remote code execution by bypassing protections from a previous flaw (CVE-2012-1823).

Key Points:

Impacts all PHP versions on Windows
Allows argument injection and remote code execution
Bypasses previous CVE-2012-1823 protections
Affects XAMPP installations with specific locales by default
Patches available in PHP 8.3.8, 8.2.20, and 8.1.29

Admins are urged to update PHP immediately as exploitation attempts have already been detected. Switching to more secure solutions like Mod-PHP, FastCGI, or PHP-FPM is also recommended.

This simple yet critical bug highlights the importance of thorough security reviews and timely patching.

#PHPSecurity #CVE20244577 #RemoteCodeExecution #CyberSecurity #SoftwareVulnerability #WindowsOS #WebAppSecurity

HackerNews: https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/new-php-vulnerability-exposes-windows.html

#CVE20244577 #CVE #PHP #phpcgi #xampp #rce #watchtowr #ÑÑÐ·Ð²Ð¸Ð¼Ð¾ÑÑÐ¸ #ÑÑÐ·Ð²Ð¸Ð¼Ð¾ÑÑÐ¸_php #ÑÑÐ·Ð²Ð¸Ð¼Ð¾ÑÑÑ

##
jbz@indieweb.social at 2024-06-20T14:00:09.000Z ##

ï½¢ The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-4577 and carrying a severity rating of 9.8 out of 10, stems from errors in the way PHP converts Unicode characters into ASCII. A feature built into Windows known as Best Fit allows attackers to use a technique known as argument injection to convert user-supplied input into characters that pass malicious commands to the main PHP application ï½£

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/06/thousands-of-servers-infected-with-ransomware-via-critical-php-vulnerability/

#PHP #Ransomware #CVE20244577 #Infosec

##
malware_traffic@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T23:47:39.000Z ##

2024-06-11 (Tuesday): I saw a single probe for CVE-2024-4577 from 221.122.67[.]75 using the "auto_prepend_file" method hit an Ubuntu Apache web server I'm currently running. I saved a sanitized example of the traffic in a #pcap available at: https://malware-traffic-analysis.net/2024/06/11/index.html

#CVE20244577
#CVE_2024_4577

This is a vulnerability against outdated versions of PHP for Windows that was publicly announced on 2024-06-06.

A quick write-up from my employer is available at: https://github.com/PaloAltoNetworks/Unit42-timely-threat-intel/blob/main/2024-06-11-CVE-2024-4577.txt

Or you could just search for the vulnerability on your own, since there's been a lot of discussion about it lately.

youranonriots@kolektiva.social at 2024-06-12T00:39:29.000Z ##

2024-06-11 (Tuesday): Our telemetry reveals ongoing exploitation attempts of #CVE20244577 in #PHP on Windows. Our customers are protected from these exploits including the "auto_append_file" method. More information we found on this vulnerability at https://bit.ly/4ekJJjx

##
parvXtl@tech.lgbt at 2024-06-14T20:53:17.000Z ##

Ransomware attackers quickly weaponize #PHP #vulnerability with 9.8 severity rating, 20240614,
by Dan G,
https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/06/thousands-of-servers-infected-with-ransomware-via-critical-php-vulnerability/

ã... #CVE2024_4577 ... stems from errors in the way PHP converts #Unicode characters into ASCII. A feature built into #Windows known as #BestFit allows attackers to use a technique known as argument injection to convert user-supplied input into characters that pass malicious commands to the main PHP application.ã

... I want to know (not in depth) about the role of "Best Fit" https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-ucoderef/d1980631-6401-428e-a49d-d71394be7da8 in it.

Nothing from Censys, Imperva; from NIST https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-4577 ...

ã... if the system is set up to use certain code pages, Windows may use "Best-Fit" behavior to replace characters in command line given to Win32 API functions. PHP CGI module may misinterpret those characters as PHP options, which may allow a malicious user to pass options to PHP binary being run, and thus reveal the source code of scripts, ...ã

... unsatisfying, oh well.

#MSWindows

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T20:37:43.967Z ##

GreyNoise: Whatâs Going on With CVE-2024-4577 (Critical RCE in PHP)?
GreyNoise analyzes the different payloads observed that leverage CVE-2024-4577 (see parent toots above). CISA added CVE-2024-4577 to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog yesterday 12 June 2024. IOC are provided but scattered across Exhibits A-D (4 sections).

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T14:32:59.347Z ##

Imperva: Update: CVE-2024-4577 quickly weaponized to distribute "TellYouThePass" Ransomware
From as early as June 8th, Imperva detected attacker activity leveraging this CVE-2024-4577 to deliver malware, which we have now identified to be a part of the "TellYouThePass" ransomware campaign. (See parent toots above for more information on CVE-2024-4577). TellYouThePass is a ransomware that has been seen since 2019, targeting businesses and individuals, in a campaign for both Windows and Linux systems. It commonly leverages CVE-2021-44228 (Apache Log4j), and has also been seen using CVE-2023-46604, among others. Imperva described the attack vector, and has a technical analysis of the sample. IOC provided.

h/t: @BleepingComputer reporting: TellYouThePass ransomware exploits recent PHP RCE flaw to breach servers

#threatintel #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #ransomware #TellYouThePass #IOC

##
kpwn at 2024-06-10T19:35:22.403Z ##

SCNR

https://infosec.exchange/@ibboard@hachyderm.io/112585613637222411

#Pentesting #AppSec #InfoSec #CyberSecurity #BugBounty #Hacking #CVE #CVE_2024_4577 #Memes

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-10T00:10:19.224Z ##

SANS ISC: Attacker Probing for New PHP Vulnerablity CVE-2024-4577
More honeypot exploitation attempts for the PHP RCE vulnerability CVE-2024-4577: @jullrich of SANS Technology Institute Internet Storm Center (ISC) reports that 79.124.49.158 which has been active in their logs since March 2024 and previously attempted other PHP-related exploits, was caught using an exploit matching watchTowr's Proof of Concept (see parent toot above). Note: Johannes misspelled watchTowr.

VirusTotal check of IP address: "4/93 security vendors flagged this IP address as malicious" and "according to source CrowdSec: Behaviors: HTTP DoS / HTTP Exploit / HTTP Scan"

#CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #IOC #threatintel #honeypot

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-08T16:57:54.341Z ##

Orange Sauce, a self-described "Student/Information security enthusiast" reports CVE-2024-4577 exploitation in the wild (note: against a honeypot) on Twitter. The linked VirusTotal check is allegedly a Gh0stRAT payload. Chinese cybersecurity company QuanXIN also reports active exploitation. cc: @todb @wdormann

IOC:

  • 138[.]201[.]126[.]53
  • hxxp://154[.]201[.]91[.]59:44557/system64.exe
  • a4b25c7a464cabbedef80a704ec8c7cd84a98073b055ddc42f2fb5b7d81ff250

youranonriots@kolektiva.social at 2024-06-12T00:39:29.000Z ##

2024-06-11 (Tuesday): Our telemetry reveals ongoing exploitation attempts of #CVE20244577 in #PHP on Windows. Our customers are protected from these exploits including the "auto_append_file" method. More information we found on this vulnerability at https://bit.ly/4ekJJjx

##
ks982579@techhub.social at 2024-06-08T13:55:32.000Z ##

A new critical security flaw (CVE-2024-4577) affecting all versions of PHP on Windows has been disclosed. This CGI argument injection vulnerability allows remote code execution by bypassing protections from a previous flaw (CVE-2012-1823).

Key Points:

Impacts all PHP versions on Windows
Allows argument injection and remote code execution
Bypasses previous CVE-2012-1823 protections
Affects XAMPP installations with specific locales by default
Patches available in PHP 8.3.8, 8.2.20, and 8.1.29

Admins are urged to update PHP immediately as exploitation attempts have already been detected. Switching to more secure solutions like Mod-PHP, FastCGI, or PHP-FPM is also recommended.

This simple yet critical bug highlights the importance of thorough security reviews and timely patching.

#PHPSecurity #CVE20244577 #RemoteCodeExecution #CyberSecurity #SoftwareVulnerability #WindowsOS #WebAppSecurity

HackerNews: https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/new-php-vulnerability-exposes-windows.html

##

CptSuperlative@toot.cat at 2024-06-14T19:50:39.000Z ##

@pluralistic

You may need to update your thread.

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-4577 and carrying a severity rating of 9.8 out of 10, stems from errors in the way PHP converts Unicode characters into ASCII. A feature built into Windows known as Best Fit allows attackers to use a technique known as argument injection to convert user-supplied input into characters that pass malicious commands to the main PHP application. Exploits allow attackers to bypass CVE-2012-1823, a critical code execution vulnerability patched in PHP in 2012.

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/06/thousands-of-servers-infected-with-ransomware-via-critical-php-vulnerability/

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-06-14T15:41:00.000Z ##

Cyble analyzes the exploitation of recently patched PHP vulnerability CVE-2024-4577

ðï¸ [Cyble] https://link.is.it/w6pxah

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T21:41:25.674Z ##

@da_667 I'm trying to determine if CVE-2024-4577 is actually getting exploited in the wild as opposed to just honeypotting.

  • 07 June 2024, honeypot: https://twitter.com/burp_heart/status/1799455219543404633
  • 07 June 2024, unknown: https://twitter.com/Xlab_qax/status/1799418841149436318
  • 09 June 2024, honeypot: https://isc.sans.edu/diary/rss/30994
  • 09 June 2024, confirmed by @ibboard as an actual exploit attempt: https://hachyderm.io/@ibboard/112596520277998664
  • 10 June 2024, actual exploitation, and used in a ransomware attack: https://www.imperva.com/blog/update-cve-2024-4577-quickly-weaponized-to-distribute-tellyouthepass-ransomware/

There is a good chance that this will be added to the CISA KEV Catalog based on the evidence.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T23:33:28.000Z ##

@ibboard Dunno if you already seen it but the proof of concept for CVE-2024-4577 is out and uses that partial string: https://labs.watchtowr.com/no-way-php-strikes-again-cve-2024-4577/

Just for context, is the script kiddy attempting to exploit your actual server or a honeypot?

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T22:49:49.000Z ##

@derickr Devcore only mentions traditional Chinese simplified Chinese, and Japanese locales as having been verified. Do you see other locales as potentially vulnerable?
There's also honey exploitation attempts observed so far. Do you think there might be mass exploitation now that a Proof of Concept is available for CVE-2024-4577?

##
derickr@phpc.social at 2024-06-10T14:43:36.000Z ##

@sean @ramsey In short:

CVE-2024-4577 enables remote attackers to execute arbitrary code if the Windows system locale is set to Chinese/Japanese locales and CGI is running under Apache.

The issue arises when Apache passes a request URI without a question mark to PHP-CGI.
In Chinese/Japanese system locales, Windows transforms certain non-ASCII characters to ASCII using a "best fit" mapping.

Command line filtering code failed to account for this behaviour, allowing attackers to bypass checks.

##
sans_isc@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-09T21:05:25.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-6101 (high severity) Inappropriate implementation in WebAssembly
  • CVE-2024-6102 (high severity) Out of bounds memory access in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-6103 (high severity) Use after free in Dawn

##

CVE-2024-38093
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-20T21:31:54

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-06-20T21:30:23.712Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) pushed out Chromium-based security advisories for Microsoft Edge, which includes patches for the 4 disclosed Google Chrome CVEs from Tuesday (see parent toot above) as well as

  • CVE-2024-38082 (4.7 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38093 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

The vulnerabilities have different FAQ, you should check them out. Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

#MSRC #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE_2024_38082 #Chrome #Chromium #CVE_2024_38093

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-20T21:30:23.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-38082 (4.7 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38093 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

  • CVE-2024-38082 (4.7 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

  • CVE-2024-38082 (4.7 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38093 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-30103
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-20T17:26:40.603000

28 posts

Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-06-20T16:13:20.388Z ##

People on Twitter are super hot for CVE-2024-30103 (CVSSv3: 8.8 high, disclosed 11 June 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. It is being referred to as the zero click RCE, and Morphisec intends to release proof of concept and vulnerability details at DEFCON 32 from 08-11 August 2024 (50 days away).

#CVE_2024_30103 #MSRC #Microsoft #Outlook #vulnerability #CVE

##
cR0w at 2024-06-12T17:37:45.404Z ##

So what happened to the update availability from the Microsoft Download Center for #CVE_2024_30103?

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-06-12T16:34:49.522Z ##

ICYMI, yesterday's #PatchTuesday had a RCE for Outlook.

This vulnerability, if exploited, can allow attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected systems, leading to potential data breaches, unauthorized access, and other malicious activities.

This Microsoft Outlook vulnerability can be circulated from user to user and doesnât require a click to execute. Rather, execution initiates when an affected email is opened. This is notably dangerous for accounts using Microsoft Outlookâs auto-open email feature.
blog.morphisec.com/cve-2024-30103-microsoft-outlook-vulnerability

#CVE_2024_30103 #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T19:55:31.368Z ##

Morphisec: Youâve Got Mail: Critical Microsoft Outlook Vulnerability Executes as Email is Opened
Morphisec intends to release proof of concept and vulnerability details about CVE-2024-30103 (CVSSv3: 8.8 high, disclosed 11 June 2024 by Microsoft) Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability... and information on a zero-day vulnerability at DEFCON 32 (08-11 August 2024). Interestingly, Morphisec refers to CVE-2024-30103 as "a significant potential zero-day vulnerability" without providing any evidence of it being a zero-day.

#CVE_2024_30103 #vulnerability #CVE #Outlook

##

CVE-2024-37891
(4.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-20T12:44:22.977000

1 posts

urllib3 is a user-friendly HTTP client library for Python. When using urllib3's proxy support with `ProxyManager`, the `Proxy-Authorization` header is only sent to the configured proxy, as expected. However, when sending HTTP requests *without* using urllib3's proxy support, it's possible to accidentally configure the `Proxy-Authorization` header even though it won't have any effect as the reques

iampytest1 at 2024-06-18T17:49:06.799Z ##

Python's urllib3 has fixed a low severity vulnerability in version 2.2.2, which was released yesterday.
This vulnerability has been assigned CVE-2024-37891.
For those not familiar with urllib3, it describes it's self as

a powerful, user-friendly HTTP client for Python

It is used by many projects and libraries, including the popular requests library.

https://github.com/urllib3/urllib3/security/advisories/GHSA-34jh-p97f-mpxf

#CVE_2024_37891 #urllib3 #pythonsecurity

##

CVE-2024-29012(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-20T09:31:06

2 posts

Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS HTTP server allows an authenticated remote attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS) via sscanf function.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-20T11:11:21.951Z ##

SonicWall security advisories:

  • Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in SonicOS HTTP server CVE-2024-29012 (4.9 medium) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS HTTP server allows an authenticated remote attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS) via sscanf function. SonicWall PSIRT is not aware of active exploitation in the wild. No reports of a PoC have been made public and malicious use of this vulnerability has not been reported to SonicWall.
  • Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in SonicOS SSL-VPN CVE-2024-29013 (5.3 medium) Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS SSL-VPN allows an authenticated remote attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS) via memcpy function. SonicWall PSIRT is not aware of active exploitation in the wild. No reports of a PoC have been made public and malicious use of this vulnerability has not been reported to SonicWall.

#CVE_2024_29012 #CVE_2024_29013 #Sonicwall #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-20T11:11:21.000Z ##

SonicWall security advisories:

  • Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in SonicOS HTTP server CVE-2024-29012 (4.9 medium) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS HTTP server allows an authenticated remote attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS) via sscanf function. SonicWall PSIRT is not aware of active exploitation in the wild. No reports of a PoC have been made public and malicious use of this vulnerability has not been reported to SonicWall.
  • Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in SonicOS SSL-VPN CVE-2024-29013 (5.3 medium) Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS SSL-VPN allows an authenticated remote attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS) via memcpy function. SonicWall PSIRT is not aware of active exploitation in the wild. No reports of a PoC have been made public and malicious use of this vulnerability has not been reported to SonicWall.

CVE-2024-23443
(4.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-19T15:30:56

2 posts

A high-privileged user, allowed to create custom osquery packs 17 could affect the availability of Kibana by uploading a maliciously crafted osquery pack.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-14T11:21:17.170Z ##

Elastic security advisories:

  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update (ESA-2024-11) CVE-2024-23443 (4.9 medium) Kibana uncontrolled resource consumption (ESA-2024-11) A high-privileged user, allowed to create custom osquery packs 5 could affect the availability of Kibana by uploading a maliciously crafted osquery pack.
  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update CVE-2024-23442 (6.1 medium) Kibana open redirect issue (ESA-2024-10). An open redirect issue was discovered in Kibana that could lead to a user being redirected to an arbitrary website if they use a maliciously crafted Kibana URL.
  • Kibana 7.17.22 / 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-17) CVE-2024-2887 (9.9 critical) Kibana RCE due to chromium type confusion (ESA-2024-17) On March 26, 2024, a type confusion vulnerability was found in WebAssembly in Google Chrome version prior to 123.0.6312.86 which allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

No mention of exploitation.

#Elastic #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23443 #CVE_2024_23442 #Kibana #CVE_2024_2887

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-14T11:21:17.000Z ##

Elastic security advisories:

  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update (ESA-2024-11) CVE-2024-23443 (4.9 medium) Kibana uncontrolled resource consumption (ESA-2024-11) A high-privileged user, allowed to create custom osquery packs 5 could affect the availability of Kibana by uploading a maliciously crafted osquery pack.
  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update CVE-2024-23442 (6.1 medium) Kibana open redirect issue (ESA-2024-10). An open redirect issue was discovered in Kibana that could lead to a user being redirected to an arbitrary website if they use a maliciously crafted Kibana URL.
  • Kibana 7.17.22 / 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-17) CVE-2024-2887 (9.9 critical) Kibana RCE due to chromium type confusion (ESA-2024-17) On March 26, 2024, a type confusion vulnerability was found in WebAssembly in Google Chrome version prior to 123.0.6312.86 which allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-37902
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-18T15:24:02

1 posts

## Summary DeepJavaLibrary(DJL) versions 0.1.0 through 0.27.0 do not prevent absolute path archived artifacts from inserting archived files directly into the system, overwriting system files. This is fixed in DJL 0.28.0 and patched in DJL Large Model Inference containers 0.27.0. **Impacted versions: 0.1.0 through 0.27.0** ## Patches Patched Deep Learning Containers: [v1.1-djl-0.27.0-inf-cpu-fu

patchnow24x7 at 2024-06-18T15:22:20.515Z ##

IF YOU ARE RUNNING AN AI COMAPNY OR AN AI RESEARCHER THEN, THIS SECURITY ALERT IS FOR YOU!!

Urgent: CVE-2024-37902 : CVSS 10 : Update your Deep Java Library Right NOW !!

Advisory:
https://github.com/deepjavalibrary/djl/security/advisories/GHSA-w877-jfw7-46rj

Patched Library:
https://github.com/deepjavalibrary/djl/releases/tag/v0.28.0

##

CVE-2024-37079
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-18T06:30:50

16 posts

vCenter Server contains a heap-overflow vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted network packet potentially leading to remote code execution.

1 repos

https://github.com/v3rce/CVE-2024-37079-RCE-POC

screaminggoat at 2024-06-19T03:00:40.920Z ##

VMware security advisory disclosed 17 June 2024: VMSA-2024-0012:VMware vCenter Server updates address heap-overflow and privilege escalation vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081)

  • CVE-2024-37079 and CVE-2024-37080 (9.8 critical) heap-overflow vulnerability (sending a specially crafted network packet potentially leading to remote code execution)
  • CVE-2024-37081 (7.8 high) privilege escalation vulnerability (elevate privileges to root on vCenter Server Appliance)

No mention of exploitation. Fuck Broadcom though for making these security advisories harder to find and no public RSS feeds for it.

#VMware #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_37079 #CVE_2024_37080 #CVE_2024_37081

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-06-18T13:37:09.800Z ##

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-19T03:00:40.000Z ##

VMware security advisory disclosed 17 June 2024: VMSA-2024-0012:VMware vCenter Server updates address heap-overflow and privilege escalation vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081)

  • CVE-2024-37079 and CVE-2024-37080 (9.8 critical) heap-overflow vulnerability (sending a specially crafted network packet potentially leading to remote code execution)
  • CVE-2024-37081 (7.8 high) privilege escalation vulnerability (elevate privileges to root on vCenter Server Appliance)

No mention of exploitation. Fuck Broadcom though for making these security advisories harder to find and no public RSS feeds for it.

#VMware #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_37079 #CVE_2024_37080 #CVE_2024_37081

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-06-18T10:02:44.955Z ##

Critical Vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081
Vulnerability Type: Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption
CWE: [[CWE-787]], [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-125]]
Sources: SecurityWeek, Cybersecurity News, Broadcom VMware advisory

Synopsis

Multiple critical vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server have been identified, potentially allowing remote code execution (RCE). These issues, detailed in VMware's security advisory VMSA-2024-0012, include CVE-2023-34048, which affects the DCE/RPC protocol implementation. The DCE/RPC (Distributed Computing Environment / Remote Procedure Call) protocol is a network protocol developed by the Open Group. It enables communication between client and server applications by allowing a program to request services from a program located on another computer within a network. DCE/RPC is based on the concept of remote procedure calls (RPC), which facilitate the execution of code on a remote system as if it were local.

Issue Summary

VMware vCenter Server, a key management component for VMware environments, contains several critical vulnerabilities. If exploited, these could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely. The most critical of these, CVE-2023-34048, has been rated with a CVSS score of 9.8, indicating high severity.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve memory corruption issues such as heap overflow and use-after-free errors in the DCE/RPC protocol. These can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the vCenter Server, leading to remote code execution and potential system compromise.

Vulnerable Products

  • vCenter Server 8.0
  • vCenter Server 7.0
  • VMware Cloud Foundation versions 4.x and 5.x

**Response Matrix:

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| ------------------ | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 8.0 U2d | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080 | 9.8, 9.8 | Critical | 8.0 U1e | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 7.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 7.0 U3r | None | FAQ |

**

Impacted Product Suites that Deploy Response Matrix 3a and 3b Components:

*

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| --------------------------------- | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 5.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 4.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |

Impact Assessment

Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could result in complete control over the affected systems, allowing attackers to perform any action, including data theft, service disruption, and further network compromise.

Patches or Workarounds

VMware has released patches to address these vulnerabilities. Administrators are advised to update to the fixed versions (8.0 U2d, 7.0 U3r) . There are no available workarounds.

Tags

#VMware #vCenterServer #CVE-2023-34048 #RemoteCodeExecution #PatchManagement #Cybersecurity

patchnow24x7 at 2024-06-18T06:48:49.920Z ##

CVE-2024-37079 and CVE-2024-37080 (CVSS Base Score 9.8) : Update your VMWare vCenter Server NOW !!

Advisory:

https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/24453

VMware vCenter Server 8.0 U2d
Downloads and Documentation:

https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/solutiondetails?patchId=5418
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/8.0/rn/vsphere-vcenter-server-80u2d-release-notes/index.html

VMware vCenter Server 8.0 U1e
Downloads and Documentation:

https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/solutiondetails?patchId=5419
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/8.0/rn/vsphere-vcenter-server-80u1e-release-notes/index.html

VMware vCenter Server 7.0 U3r
Downloads and Documentation:

https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/solutiondetails?patchId=5417
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/rn/vsphere-vcenter-server-70u3r-release-notes/index.html

Critical Vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081
Vulnerability Type: Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption
CWE: [[CWE-787]], [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-125]]
Sources: SecurityWeek, Cybersecurity News, Broadcom VMware advisory

Synopsis

Multiple critical vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server have been identified, potentially allowing remote code execution (RCE). These issues, detailed in VMware's security advisory VMSA-2024-0012, include CVE-2023-34048, which affects the DCE/RPC protocol implementation. The DCE/RPC (Distributed Computing Environment / Remote Procedure Call) protocol is a network protocol developed by the Open Group. It enables communication between client and server applications by allowing a program to request services from a program located on another computer within a network. DCE/RPC is based on the concept of remote procedure calls (RPC), which facilitate the execution of code on a remote system as if it were local.

Issue Summary

VMware vCenter Server, a key management component for VMware environments, contains several critical vulnerabilities. If exploited, these could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely. The most critical of these, CVE-2023-34048, has been rated with a CVSS score of 9.8, indicating high severity.

  • vCenter Server 8.0
  • vCenter Server 7.0
  • VMware Cloud Foundation versions 4.x and 5.x

| ------------------ | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 8.0 U2d | None | FAQ |

| vCenter Server | 7.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 7.0 U3r | None | FAQ |

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |

##

CVE-2024-37081
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-18T06:30:50

12 posts

The vCenter Server contains multiple local privilege escalation vulnerabilities due to misconfiguration of sudo.Â An authenticated local user with non-administrative privileges may exploit these issues to elevate privileges to root on vCenter Server Appliance.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-19T03:00:40.920Z ##

VMware security advisory disclosed 17 June 2024: VMSA-2024-0012:VMware vCenter Server updates address heap-overflow and privilege escalation vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081)

  • CVE-2024-37079 and CVE-2024-37080 (9.8 critical) heap-overflow vulnerability (sending a specially crafted network packet potentially leading to remote code execution)
  • CVE-2024-37081 (7.8 high) privilege escalation vulnerability (elevate privileges to root on vCenter Server Appliance)

No mention of exploitation. Fuck Broadcom though for making these security advisories harder to find and no public RSS feeds for it.

#VMware #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_37079 #CVE_2024_37080 #CVE_2024_37081

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-06-18T10:02:44.955Z ##

Critical Vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081
Vulnerability Type: Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption
CWE: [[CWE-787]], [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-125]]
Sources: SecurityWeek, Cybersecurity News, Broadcom VMware advisory

Synopsis

Multiple critical vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server have been identified, potentially allowing remote code execution (RCE). These issues, detailed in VMware's security advisory VMSA-2024-0012, include CVE-2023-34048, which affects the DCE/RPC protocol implementation. The DCE/RPC (Distributed Computing Environment / Remote Procedure Call) protocol is a network protocol developed by the Open Group. It enables communication between client and server applications by allowing a program to request services from a program located on another computer within a network. DCE/RPC is based on the concept of remote procedure calls (RPC), which facilitate the execution of code on a remote system as if it were local.

Issue Summary

VMware vCenter Server, a key management component for VMware environments, contains several critical vulnerabilities. If exploited, these could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely. The most critical of these, CVE-2023-34048, has been rated with a CVSS score of 9.8, indicating high severity.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve memory corruption issues such as heap overflow and use-after-free errors in the DCE/RPC protocol. These can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the vCenter Server, leading to remote code execution and potential system compromise.

Vulnerable Products

  • vCenter Server 8.0
  • vCenter Server 7.0
  • VMware Cloud Foundation versions 4.x and 5.x

**Response Matrix:

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| ------------------ | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 8.0 U2d | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080 | 9.8, 9.8 | Critical | 8.0 U1e | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 7.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 7.0 U3r | None | FAQ |

**

Impacted Product Suites that Deploy Response Matrix 3a and 3b Components:

*

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| --------------------------------- | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 5.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 4.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |

Impact Assessment

Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could result in complete control over the affected systems, allowing attackers to perform any action, including data theft, service disruption, and further network compromise.

Patches or Workarounds

VMware has released patches to address these vulnerabilities. Administrators are advised to update to the fixed versions (8.0 U2d, 7.0 U3r) . There are no available workarounds.

Critical Vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081
Vulnerability Type: Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption
CWE: [[CWE-787]], [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-125]]
Sources: SecurityWeek, Cybersecurity News, Broadcom VMware advisory

Synopsis

Multiple critical vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server have been identified, potentially allowing remote code execution (RCE). These issues, detailed in VMware's security advisory VMSA-2024-0012, include CVE-2023-34048, which affects the DCE/RPC protocol implementation. The DCE/RPC (Distributed Computing Environment / Remote Procedure Call) protocol is a network protocol developed by the Open Group. It enables communication between client and server applications by allowing a program to request services from a program located on another computer within a network. DCE/RPC is based on the concept of remote procedure calls (RPC), which facilitate the execution of code on a remote system as if it were local.

Issue Summary

VMware vCenter Server, a key management component for VMware environments, contains several critical vulnerabilities. If exploited, these could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely. The most critical of these, CVE-2023-34048, has been rated with a CVSS score of 9.8, indicating high severity.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve memory corruption issues such as heap overflow and use-after-free errors in the DCE/RPC protocol. These can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the vCenter Server, leading to remote code execution and potential system compromise.

Vulnerable Products

  • vCenter Server 8.0
  • vCenter Server 7.0
  • VMware Cloud Foundation versions 4.x and 5.x

**Response Matrix:

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| ------------------ | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 8.0 U2d | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080 | 9.8, 9.8 | Critical | 8.0 U1e | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 7.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 7.0 U3r | None | FAQ |

**

Impacted Product Suites that Deploy Response Matrix 3a and 3b Components:

*

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| --------------------------------- | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 5.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 4.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |

Impact Assessment

Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could result in complete control over the affected systems, allowing attackers to perform any action, including data theft, service disruption, and further network compromise.

Patches or Workarounds

VMware has released patches to address these vulnerabilities. Administrators are advised to update to the fixed versions (8.0 U2d, 7.0 U3r) . There are no available workarounds.

Tags

#VMware #vCenterServer #CVE-2023-34048 #RemoteCodeExecution #PatchManagement #Cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-37080
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-18T06:30:49

18 posts

vCenter Server contains a heap-overflow vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted network packet potentially leading to remote code execution.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-19T03:00:40.920Z ##

VMware security advisory disclosed 17 June 2024: VMSA-2024-0012:VMware vCenter Server updates address heap-overflow and privilege escalation vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081)

  • CVE-2024-37079 and CVE-2024-37080 (9.8 critical) heap-overflow vulnerability (sending a specially crafted network packet potentially leading to remote code execution)
  • CVE-2024-37081 (7.8 high) privilege escalation vulnerability (elevate privileges to root on vCenter Server Appliance)

No mention of exploitation. Fuck Broadcom though for making these security advisories harder to find and no public RSS feeds for it.

#VMware #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_37079 #CVE_2024_37080 #CVE_2024_37081

H3liumb0y at 2024-06-18T10:02:44.955Z ##

Critical Vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081
Vulnerability Type: Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption
CWE: [[CWE-787]], [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-125]]
Sources: SecurityWeek, Cybersecurity News, Broadcom VMware advisory

Synopsis

Multiple critical vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server have been identified, potentially allowing remote code execution (RCE). These issues, detailed in VMware's security advisory VMSA-2024-0012, include CVE-2023-34048, which affects the DCE/RPC protocol implementation. The DCE/RPC (Distributed Computing Environment / Remote Procedure Call) protocol is a network protocol developed by the Open Group. It enables communication between client and server applications by allowing a program to request services from a program located on another computer within a network. DCE/RPC is based on the concept of remote procedure calls (RPC), which facilitate the execution of code on a remote system as if it were local.

Issue Summary

VMware vCenter Server, a key management component for VMware environments, contains several critical vulnerabilities. If exploited, these could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely. The most critical of these, CVE-2023-34048, has been rated with a CVSS score of 9.8, indicating high severity.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve memory corruption issues such as heap overflow and use-after-free errors in the DCE/RPC protocol. These can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the vCenter Server, leading to remote code execution and potential system compromise.

Vulnerable Products

  • vCenter Server 8.0
  • vCenter Server 7.0
  • VMware Cloud Foundation versions 4.x and 5.x

**Response Matrix:

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| ------------------ | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 8.0 U2d | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080 | 9.8, 9.8 | Critical | 8.0 U1e | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 7.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 7.0 U3r | None | FAQ |

**

Impacted Product Suites that Deploy Response Matrix 3a and 3b Components:

*

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| --------------------------------- | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 5.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 4.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |

Impact Assessment

Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could result in complete control over the affected systems, allowing attackers to perform any action, including data theft, service disruption, and further network compromise.

Patches or Workarounds

VMware has released patches to address these vulnerabilities. Administrators are advised to update to the fixed versions (8.0 U2d, 7.0 U3r) . There are no available workarounds.

H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-18T10:02:44.000Z ##

Critical Vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081
Vulnerability Type: Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption
CWE: [[CWE-787]], [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-125]]
Sources: SecurityWeek, Cybersecurity News, Broadcom VMware advisory

Synopsis

Multiple critical vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server have been identified, potentially allowing remote code execution (RCE). These issues, detailed in VMware's security advisory VMSA-2024-0012, include CVE-2023-34048, which affects the DCE/RPC protocol implementation. The DCE/RPC (Distributed Computing Environment / Remote Procedure Call) protocol is a network protocol developed by the Open Group. It enables communication between client and server applications by allowing a program to request services from a program located on another computer within a network. DCE/RPC is based on the concept of remote procedure calls (RPC), which facilitate the execution of code on a remote system as if it were local.

Issue Summary

VMware vCenter Server, a key management component for VMware environments, contains several critical vulnerabilities. If exploited, these could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely. The most critical of these, CVE-2023-34048, has been rated with a CVSS score of 9.8, indicating high severity.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve memory corruption issues such as heap overflow and use-after-free errors in the DCE/RPC protocol. These can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the vCenter Server, leading to remote code execution and potential system compromise.

Vulnerable Products

  • vCenter Server 8.0
  • vCenter Server 7.0
  • VMware Cloud Foundation versions 4.x and 5.x

**Response Matrix:

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| ------------------ | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 8.0 U2d | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080 | 9.8, 9.8 | Critical | 8.0 U1e | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 7.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 7.0 U3r | None | FAQ |

**

Impacted Product Suites that Deploy Response Matrix 3a and 3b Components:

*

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| --------------------------------- | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 5.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 4.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |

Impact Assessment

Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could result in complete control over the affected systems, allowing attackers to perform any action, including data theft, service disruption, and further network compromise.

Patches or Workarounds

VMware has released patches to address these vulnerabilities. Administrators are advised to update to the fixed versions (8.0 U2d, 7.0 U3r) . There are no available workarounds.

CVE-2023-32191
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-06-17T22:30:49

2 posts

### Impact When RKE provisions a cluster, it stores the cluster state in a configmap called `full-cluster-state` inside the `kube-system` namespace of the cluster itself. This cluster state object contains information used to set up the K8s cluster, which may include the following sensitive data: - RancherKubernetesEngineConfig - RKENodeConfig - SSH username - SSH private key

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-17T12:43:31.090000

4 posts

Certain ASUS router models have authentication bypass vulnerability, allowing unauthenticated remote attackers to log in the device.

domainlabsk at 2024-06-19T21:04:17.530Z ##

ZraniteÄ¾nosÅ¥ #CVE20243080 bola objavenÃ¡ v siedmich smerovaÄoch WiFi spoloÄnosti Asus.

ÃtoÄnÃ­k mÃ´Å¾e na diaÄ¾ku obÃ­sÅ¥ prihlÃ¡senie a prihlÃ¡siÅ¥ sa do smerovaÄa bez znalosti hesla.

##
avoidthehack at 2024-06-17T16:00:01.337Z ##

#ASUS warns of critical remote authentication bypass on 7 #routers

Vulnerability is tracked as CVE-2024-3080 and is an authentication bypass where unauthenticated remote attackers can take control of affected devices.

ASUS has released an updated #firmware version that should address this vulnerability.

Update ASAP.

ASUS also warned of a separate vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-3912, that affects router models no longer supported (they are end of life). No #security update available for these - users should replace them ASAP or flash with maintained #opensource firmware compatible with the device.

#cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/asus-warns-of-critical-remote-authentication-bypass-on-7-routers/

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-06-16T04:12:12.331Z ##

CVE-2024-3080 : Update your ASUS router Firmware NOW !!

Advisory : https://www.twcert.org.tw/en/cp-139-7860-760b1-2.html

FAQ on Firmware Update : https://www.asus.com/support/faq/1008000/

#PatchNOW
#cybersecurity
#hacked
#Cyberattack

#ASUS warns of critical remote authentication bypass on 7 #routers

Vulnerability is tracked as CVE-2024-3080 and is an authentication bypass where unauthenticated remote attackers can take control of affected devices.

ASUS has released an updated #firmware version that should address this vulnerability.

Update ASAP.

ASUS also warned of a separate vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-3912, that affects router models no longer supported (they are end of life). No #security update available for these - users should replace them ASAP or flash with maintained #opensource firmware compatible with the device.

CVE-2024-6045
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-17T06:30:35

4 posts

Certain models of D-Link wireless routers contain an undisclosed factory testing backdoor. Unauthenticated attackers on the local area network can force the device to enable Telnet service by accessing a specific URL and can log in by using the administrator credentials obtained from analyzing the firmware.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-19T03:08:14.831Z ##

Taiwan CERT/CC: D-Link router - Hidden Backdoor
what the fuck D-Link. This is the second time this year that D-Link products were discovered to have a backdoor in them! CVE-2024-6045 (8.8 high)

Certain models of D-Link wireless routers contain an undisclosed factory testing backdoor. Unauthenticated attackers on the local area network can force the device to enable Telnet service by accessing a specific URL and can log in by using the administrator credentials obtained from analyzing the firmware.

h/t: @jullrich of @sans_isc

#CVE_2024_6045 #Dlink #backdoor #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-32896
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-06-14T18:31:43

13 posts

there is a possible way to bypass due to a logic error in the code. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-14T03:13:46.513Z ##

@Ongion in looking up "Pixel firmwire" I came across a website that lists completely incorrect information for CVE-2024-32896: https://www.zero-day.cz/database/891/

CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:H/RL:O/RC:C

I plugged it into a calculator and the CVSSv3.1 base score is 7.8 high severity, and the temporal is 7.5. I don't know where they got that information from. They also claim that the CWE is "CWE-20 - Improper input validation"

I just checked NVD again: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-32896#VulnChangeHistorySection

there is a possible way to bypass due to a logic error in the code. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T15:58:35.754Z ##

@jgreig According to GrapheneOS, CVE-2024-32896 is the 2nd part of the fix for the CVE-2024-29748 vulnerability actively exploited in the wild by forensic companies: https://grapheneos.social/@GrapheneOS/112609239806949074 h/t @caspicat cc: @jwarminsky

And that CVE-2024-32896 is not Pixel-specific

##
caspicat at 2024-06-13T15:46:19.399Z ##

@screaminggoat
Note CVE-2024-32896 is not Pixel specific according GrapheneOS thread https://grapheneos.social/@GrapheneOS/112609239806949074

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T14:53:48.367Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog (link might not work)
Hot off the press! CISA adds three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-32896 Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-26169 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Error Reporting Service Improper Privilege Management Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical) Progress Telerik Report Server Authentication Bypass by Spoofing Vulnerability

cc: @hrbrmstr (I still beat the RSS feed)

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-14T03:13:46.000Z ##

@Ongion in looking up "Pixel firmwire" I came across a website that lists completely incorrect information for CVE-2024-32896: https://www.zero-day.cz/database/891/

CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H/E:H/RL:O/RC:C

I plugged it into a calculator and the CVSSv3.1 base score is 7.8 high severity, and the temporal is 7.5. I don't know where they got that information from. They also claim that the CWE is "CWE-20 - Improper input validation"

I just checked NVD again: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-32896#VulnChangeHistorySection

there is a possible way to bypass due to a logic error in the code. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.

CVE-2024-23442
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-06-14T15:31:32

2 posts

An open redirect issue was discovered in Kibana that could lead to a user being redirected to an arbitrary website if they use a maliciously crafted Kibana URL.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-14T11:21:17.170Z ##

Elastic security advisories:

  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update (ESA-2024-11) CVE-2024-23443 (4.9 medium) Kibana uncontrolled resource consumption (ESA-2024-11) A high-privileged user, allowed to create custom osquery packs 5 could affect the availability of Kibana by uploading a maliciously crafted osquery pack.
  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update CVE-2024-23442 (6.1 medium) Kibana open redirect issue (ESA-2024-10). An open redirect issue was discovered in Kibana that could lead to a user being redirected to an arbitrary website if they use a maliciously crafted Kibana URL.
  • Kibana 7.17.22 / 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-17) CVE-2024-2887 (9.9 critical) Kibana RCE due to chromium type confusion (ESA-2024-17) On March 26, 2024, a type confusion vulnerability was found in WebAssembly in Google Chrome version prior to 123.0.6312.86 which allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

No mention of exploitation.

#Elastic #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23443 #CVE_2024_23442 #Kibana #CVE_2024_2887

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-14T11:21:17.000Z ##

Elastic security advisories:

  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update (ESA-2024-11) CVE-2024-23443 (4.9 medium) Kibana uncontrolled resource consumption (ESA-2024-11) A high-privileged user, allowed to create custom osquery packs 5 could affect the availability of Kibana by uploading a maliciously crafted osquery pack.
  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update CVE-2024-23442 (6.1 medium) Kibana open redirect issue (ESA-2024-10). An open redirect issue was discovered in Kibana that could lead to a user being redirected to an arbitrary website if they use a maliciously crafted Kibana URL.
  • Kibana 7.17.22 / 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-17) CVE-2024-2887 (9.9 critical) Kibana RCE due to chromium type confusion (ESA-2024-17) On March 26, 2024, a type confusion vulnerability was found in WebAssembly in Google Chrome version prior to 123.0.6312.86 which allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

No mention of exploitation.

#Elastic #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23443 #CVE_2024_23442 #Kibana #CVE_2024_2887

##

CVE-2024-3912
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-14T12:30:55

2 posts

Certain models of ASUS routers have an arbitrary firmware upload vulnerability. An unauthenticated remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary system commands on the device.

avoidthehack at 2024-06-17T16:00:01.337Z ##

#ASUS warns of critical remote authentication bypass on 7 #routers

Vulnerability is tracked as CVE-2024-3080 and is an authentication bypass where unauthenticated remote attackers can take control of affected devices.

ASUS has released an updated #firmware version that should address this vulnerability.

Update ASAP.

ASUS also warned of a separate vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-3912, that affects router models no longer supported (they are end of life). No #security update available for these - users should replace them ASAP or flash with maintained #opensource firmware compatible with the device.

#cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/asus-warns-of-critical-remote-authentication-bypass-on-7-routers/

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-17T16:00:01.000Z ##

#ASUS warns of critical remote authentication bypass on 7 #routers

Vulnerability is tracked as CVE-2024-3080 and is an authentication bypass where unauthenticated remote attackers can take control of affected devices.

ASUS has released an updated #firmware version that should address this vulnerability.

Update ASAP.

ASUS also warned of a separate vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-3912, that affects router models no longer supported (they are end of life). No #security update available for these - users should replace them ASAP or flash with maintained #opensource firmware compatible with the device.

#cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/asus-warns-of-critical-remote-authentication-bypass-on-7-routers/

Dropbox Desktop Folder Sharing Mark-of-the-Web Bypass Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass the Mark-of-the-Web protection mechanism on affected installations of Dropbox Desktop. ##

CVE-2024-30058
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-13T21:30:58

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T20:29:06.196Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) dropped 21 security advisories related to Microsoft Edge and Chromium-based vulnerabilities. For convenience, I will not link all of the ones already disclosed by Google Chrome from 11 June 2024 (see parent toot above). Instead, I will list the new ones:

  • CVE-2024-30057 (CVSS:3.1 5.4 medium) Microsoft Edge for iOS Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-30058 (5.4 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38083 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

The other CVEs match those disclosed by Google on Tuesday. None of the above Microsoft Edge-specific vulnerabilities were marked as publicly disclosed or exploited. None of Google Chrome's CVEs were noted to have an exploit in the wild either.

#MSRC #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #Chrome #Chromium #Edge #CVE_2024_30057 #CVE_2024_30058 #CVE_2024_380083

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T20:29:06.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) dropped 21 security advisories related to Microsoft Edge and Chromium-based vulnerabilities. For convenience, I will not link all of the ones already disclosed by Google Chrome from 11 June 2024 (see parent toot above). Instead, I will list the new ones:

  • CVE-2024-30058 (5.4 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38083 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

The other CVEs match those disclosed by Google on Tuesday. None of the above Microsoft Edge-specific vulnerabilities were marked as publicly disclosed or exploited. None of Google Chrome's CVEs were noted to have an exploit in the wild either.

##

CVE-2024-34102
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-13T19:34:00

8 posts

Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.7, 2.4.6-p5, 2.4.5-p7, 2.4.4-p8 and earlier are affected by an Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted XML document that references external entities. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-20T23:30:10.701Z ##

@oversecurity @shellsharks Designer vulnerability: "CosmicSting" CVE-2024-34102 9.8 critical, disclosed 13 June 2024 by Adobe Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') allowing for Arbitrary code execution.
Origin of designer name by Sansec:CosmicSting attack threatens 75% of Adobe Commerce stores

#CVE_2024_34102 #Adobe #CosmicSting #vulnerability #CVE #designervulnerabilities

Adobe Framemaker Publishing Server versions 2020.3, 2022.2 and earlier are affected by an Improper Authentication vulnerability that could result in privilege escalation. ##

CVE-2012-1823(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 97.31%

updated 2024-06-13T06:31:59

4 posts

sapi/cgi/cgi_main.c in PHP before 5.3.12 and 5.4.x before 5.4.2, when configured as a CGI script (aka php-cgi), does not properly handle query strings that lack an = (equals sign) character, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by placing command-line options in the query string, related to lack of skipping a certain php_getopt for the 'd' case.

Nuclei template

6 repos

https://github.com/drone789/CVE-2012-1823

https://github.com/Unix13/metasploitable2

https://github.com/0xl0k1/CVE-2012-1823

https://github.com/tardummy01/oscp_scripts-1

https://github.com/Fatalitysec/CVE-2012-1823

https://github.com/cyberharsh/PHP_CVE-2012-1823

elazar@phpc.social at 2024-06-14T23:05:24.000Z ##

"Exploits allow attackers to bypass CVE-2012-1823, a critical code execution vulnerability patched in PHP in 2012."

"... roughly half of the compromises observed show clear signs of running XAMPP... maintainers explicitly say their software isnât suitable for production systems."

This is the price of running not-for-production and now-unsupported software in production.

Play stupid games, win stupid prizes. ð¤·ââï¸

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/06/thousands-of-servers-infected-with-ransomware-via-critical-php-vulnerability/

##
CptSuperlative@toot.cat at 2024-06-14T19:50:39.000Z ##

@pluralistic

You may need to update your thread.

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-4577 and carrying a severity rating of 9.8 out of 10, stems from errors in the way PHP converts Unicode characters into ASCII. A feature built into Windows known as Best Fit allows attackers to use a technique known as argument injection to convert user-supplied input into characters that pass malicious commands to the main PHP application. Exploits allow attackers to bypass CVE-2012-1823, a critical code execution vulnerability patched in PHP in 2012.

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/06/thousands-of-servers-infected-with-ransomware-via-critical-php-vulnerability/

##

"... roughly half of the compromises observed show clear signs of running XAMPP... maintainers explicitly say their software isnât suitable for production systems."

##
CptSuperlative@toot.cat at 2024-06-14T19:50:39.000Z ##

@pluralistic

You may need to update your thread.

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-4577 and carrying a severity rating of 9.8 out of 10, stems from errors in the way PHP converts Unicode characters into ASCII. A feature built into Windows known as Best Fit allows attackers to use a technique known as argument injection to convert user-supplied input into characters that pass malicious commands to the main PHP application. Exploits allow attackers to bypass CVE-2012-1823, a critical code execution vulnerability patched in PHP in 2012.

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/06/thousands-of-servers-infected-with-ransomware-via-critical-php-vulnerability/

CVE-2024-3699
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-06-12T18:31:43

1 posts

Use of hard-coded password to the patients' database allows an attacker to retrieve sensitive data stored in the database. The password is the same among allÂ drEryk Gabinet installations.This issue affects drEryk Gabinet software versions from 7.0.0.0 through 9.17.0.0.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T14:32:45.000Z ##

CERT.PL (Poland): Vulnerabilities in medical clinics software
CERT.PL of Poland mentions 3 vulnerabilities in Eurosoft Przychodnia, drEryk Gabinet and Simple Care (medical software) which use hardcoded credentials. CVE-2024-1228, CVE-2024-3699 and CVE-2024-3700 all have CVSSv4 scores of 9.3 critical severity. While the first two have patches, Simple Care is noted to be no longer supported.

#vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_1228 #CVE_2024_3699 #CVE_2024_3700

##

CVE-2024-5907(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-12T18:30:48

2 posts

A privilege escalation (PE) vulnerability in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices enables a local user to execute programs with elevated privileges. However, execution does require the local user to successfully exploit a race condition, which makes this vulnerability difficult to exploit.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T16:26:04.474Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday (er, Wednesday) from Palo Alto Networks:

  • CVE-2024-5905 (CVSSv4: 2.0 low) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Disrupt Functionality of the Agent
  • CVE-2024-5906 (CVSSv4: 4.8 medium) Prisma Cloud Compute: Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability in the Web Interface
  • CVE-2024-5907 (CVSSv4: 5.2 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-5908 (CVSSv4: 5.5 medium) GlobalProtect App: Encrypted Credential Exposure via Log Files
  • CVE-2024-5909 (CVSSv4: 6.8 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Disable the Agent

Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue.

#PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-5909(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-12T18:30:48

2 posts

A problem with a protection mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices allows a low privileged local Windows user to disable the agent. This issue may be leveraged by malware to disable the Cortex XDR agent and then to perform malicious activity.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T16:26:04.474Z ##

  • CVE-2024-5905 (CVSSv4: 2.0 low) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Disrupt Functionality of the Agent

  • CVE-2024-5908 (CVSSv4: 5.5 medium) GlobalProtect App: Encrypted Credential Exposure via Log Files

##

CVE-2024-5906(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-12T18:30:48

2 posts

A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks Prisma Cloud Compute software enables a malicious administrator with add/edit permissions for identity providers to store a JavaScript payload using the web interface on Prisma Cloud Compute. This enables a malicious administrator to perform actions in the context of another user's browser when accessed by that other user.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T16:26:04.474Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday (er, Wednesday) from Palo Alto Networks:

  • CVE-2024-5905 (CVSSv4: 2.0 low) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Disrupt Functionality of the Agent
  • CVE-2024-5906 (CVSSv4: 4.8 medium) Prisma Cloud Compute: Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability in the Web Interface
  • CVE-2024-5907 (CVSSv4: 5.2 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-5908 (CVSSv4: 5.5 medium) GlobalProtect App: Encrypted Credential Exposure via Log Files
  • CVE-2024-5909 (CVSSv4: 6.8 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Disable the Agent

Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue.

#PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T16:26:04.000Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday (er, Wednesday) from Palo Alto Networks:

  • CVE-2024-5905 (CVSSv4: 2.0 low) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Disrupt Functionality of the Agent
  • CVE-2024-5906 (CVSSv4: 4.8 medium) Prisma Cloud Compute: Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability in the Web Interface
  • CVE-2024-5907 (CVSSv4: 5.2 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Privilege Escalation (PE) Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-5908 (CVSSv4: 5.5 medium) GlobalProtect App: Encrypted Credential Exposure via Log Files
  • CVE-2024-5909 (CVSSv4: 6.8 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows User Can Disable the Agent

Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue.

#PaloAltoNetworks #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-5908(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-12T18:30:48

2 posts

A problem with the Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app can result in exposure of encrypted user credentials, used for connecting to GlobalProtect, in application logs. Normally, these application logs are only viewable by local users and are included when generating logs for troubleshooting purposes. This means that these encrypted credentials are exposed to recipients of the application logs.
