CVE-2024-1228
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-06-12T17:54:10.157000

1 posts

Use of hard-coded password to the patients' database allows an attacker to retrieve sensitive data stored in the database. The password is the same among all Eurosoft Przychodnia installations. This issue affects Eurosoft Przychodnia software beforeÂ versionÂ 20240417.001 (from that version vulnerability is fixed).

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T14:32:45.000Z ##

CERT.PL (Poland): Vulnerabilities in medical clinics software
CERT.PL of Poland mentions 3 vulnerabilities in Eurosoft Przychodnia, drEryk Gabinet and Simple Care (medical software) which use hardcoded credentials. CVE-2024-1228, CVE-2024-3699 and CVE-2024-3700 all have CVSSv4 scores of 9.3 critical severity. While the first two have patches, Simple Care is noted to be no longer supported.

#vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_1228 #CVE_2024_3699 #CVE_2024_3700

##

CVE-2024-27801(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-12T06:31:42

2 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.5, visionOS 1.2, iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, watchOS 10.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to elevate privileges.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T19:56:41.542Z ##

wangtielei: PoC for CVE-2024-27801 (Universal UAF in NSXPC on all Apple platforms)
CVE-2024-27801 (CVSS score pending, disclosed 10 June 2024 by Apple) Elevation of Privilege vulnerability in Foundation (of iOS, tvOS, visionOS, iPadOS, watchOS, and macOS Sonoma). Wangtielei describes it as a Use After Free "in the low level implementation of NSXPC that has been present since the initial release of NSXPC (over decade ago)."

This vulnerability could have potentially allowed malicious apps to gain unauthorized access to system services or steal user data from certain third-party applications, particularly those with architectures similar to Telegram. Our proof-of-concept attack demonstrated how a malicious app could steal chat history (such as pictures) from Telegram and transfer it to a remote server.

#CVE_2024_27801 #proofofconcept #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T19:56:41.000Z ##

wangtielei: PoC for CVE-2024-27801 (Universal UAF in NSXPC on all Apple platforms)
CVE-2024-27801 (CVSS score pending, disclosed 10 June 2024 by Apple) Elevation of Privilege vulnerability in Foundation (of iOS, tvOS, visionOS, iPadOS, watchOS, and macOS Sonoma). Wangtielei describes it as a Use After Free "in the low level implementation of NSXPC that has been present since the initial release of NSXPC (over decade ago)."

This vulnerability could have potentially allowed malicious apps to gain unauthorized access to system services or steal user data from certain third-party applications, particularly those with architectures similar to Telegram. Our proof-of-concept attack demonstrated how a malicious app could steal chat history (such as pictures) from Telegram and transfer it to a remote server.

#CVE_2024_27801 #proofofconcept #vulnerability #cve

Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

Tracked as CVE-2024-4610, exploited in the wild.

Affects âall versionsâ of Bifrost and Valhall drivers from r34p0 through r40p0.

This was originally fixed by ARM in NOV 2022, but due to #Android supply chain complexities (in this case, the device manufacturers need to integrate the fix into the deviceâs firmware), users may not have the most updated driversâ¦

#cve #cybersecurity #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/arm-warns-of-actively-exploited-flaw-in-mali-gpu-kernel-drivers

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T07:33:26.000Z ##

Active Exploitation of Mali GPU Kernel Driver Flaw

Date: June 10, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-4610
Vulnerability Type: [[Use-After-Free]] (UAF)
CWE: [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-119]]
Sources: Bleeping Computer, The Register, HotHardware

Synopsis

Arm has issued a security bulletin concerning a critical memory-related vulnerability in its Mali GPU kernel drivers, which is currently being exploited in the wild. This vulnerability affects Bifrost and Valhall GPU kernel drivers across multiple versions.

Issue Summary

The vulnerability, identified as [[CVE-2024-4610]], is a [[use-after-free]] flaw in the Mali GPU kernel drivers. This flaw allows a local non-privileged user to perform improper GPU memory operations, gaining access to already freed memory. The flaw impacts all versions of the Bifrost and Valhall drivers from r34p0 through r40p0.

Technical Key Findings

Use-after-free vulnerabilities occur when a program continues to use a pointer to a memory location after it has been freed. This can lead to serious issues such as information disclosure and arbitrary code execution. In the case of CVE-2024-4610, a local attacker could exploit this flaw to execute arbitrary code on the affected system, potentially leading to a full system compromise.

Vulnerable Products

  • Bifrost GPUs: Versions r34p0 to r40p0
  • Valhall GPUs: Versions r34p0 to r40p0
  • Devices: Including but not limited to Samsung Galaxy S20, Xiaomi Redmi K30, Motorola Edge 40, OnePlus Nord 2, Chromebooks, and various embedded systems.

Impact Assessment

Exploitation of this vulnerability can lead to severe consequences, including unauthorized access to sensitive information, system compromise, and potential deployment of malware. The vulnerability's exploitation in the wild indicates a significant risk, especially for high-value targets such as activists and journalists.

Patches or Workaround

Arm has released a patch for this vulnerability in version r41p0 of the Bifrost and Valhall GPU Kernel Driver, available since November 24, 2022. Users are advised to update their drivers to the latest version to mitigate this risk. Due to the complexity of the supply chain, some users may experience delays in receiving the updates.

Tags

#CVE-2024-4610 #MaliGPU #Arm #UseAfterFree #Vulnerability #Patch #CyberSecurity #AndroidDevices #SystemCompromise #HighRisk

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.000Z ##

Arm exploited zero-day: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
CVE-2024-4610 (CVSS score pending) Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

Arm is aware of reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild.

Why you should be worried about CVE-2024-4610: Multiple Arm Mali GPU drivers are in the KEV Catalog: CVE-2023-4211, CVE-2021-29256, CVE-2023-26083, CVE-2022-22706, CVE-2022-38181, CVE-2021-28664, and CVE-2021-28663!

h/t: @BleepingComputer Arm warns of actively exploited flaw in Mali GPU kernel drivers

#zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4610 #Arm #eitw

##

CVE-2024-21754
(1.8 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T15:31:27

5 posts

A use of password hash with insufficient computational effort vulnerability [CWE-916] affecting FortiOS version 7.4.3 and below, 7.2 all versions, 7.0 all versions, 6.4 all versions and FortiProxy version 7.4.2 and below, 7.2 all versions, 7.0 all versions, 2.0 all versions may allow aÂ privileged attacker with super-admin profile and CLI access to decrypting the backup file.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T21:43:30.870Z ##

G DATA Advanced Analytics: Give Me Your FortiGate Configuration Backup and I Rule Your Network
G DATA reveals vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file in FortiOS and FortiProxy. (See parent toot above for more information) Their analysis implies that either CVE-2024-21754 or CVE-2019-6693 were exploited in a security incident that they were investigating: "attackers were able to authenticate to the VPN... these connections have been authorized by the guest account." cc: @todb
The root cause for CVE-2024-21754: "The problem with this implementation is the single hashing round."

h/t: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_21754 #CVE_2019_6693 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-06-13T17:49:02.000Z ##

German security firm G Data has discovered that Fortinet firewalls use weak password hashes to secure backup files.

https://www.gdatasoftware.com/blog/2024/01/37834-passwords-on-a-silver-platter

Tracked as CVE-2024-21754, the vulnerability can be exploited to decrypt backup files and read a device's login credentials.

https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-423

"Those backup files are commonly sent back and forth via email, for review and control purposes."

#infosec #cybersecurity #security

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T21:43:30.000Z ##

G DATA Advanced Analytics: Give Me Your FortiGate Configuration Backup and I Rule Your Network
G DATA reveals vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file in FortiOS and FortiProxy. (See parent toot above for more information) Their analysis implies that either CVE-2024-21754 or CVE-2019-6693 were exploited in a security incident that they were investigating: "attackers were able to authenticate to the VPN... these connections have been authorized by the guest account." cc: @todb
The root cause for CVE-2024-21754: "The problem with this implementation is the single hashing round."

h/t: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_21754 #CVE_2019_6693 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-06-13T17:49:02.000Z ##

German security firm G Data has discovered that Fortinet firewalls use weak password hashes to secure backup files.

https://www.gdatasoftware.com/blog/2024/01/37834-passwords-on-a-silver-platter

Tracked as CVE-2024-21754, the vulnerability can be exploited to decrypt backup files and read a device's login credentials.

https://www.fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-23-423

"Those backup files are commonly sent back and forth via email, for review and control purposes."

#infosec #cybersecurity #security

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T15:02:03.000Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-24-128 CVE-2024-31495 (4.3 medium) Blind SQL Injection
  • FG-IR-24-036 CVE-2024-26010 (7.5 high) Buffer overflow in fgfmd
  • FG-IR-23-471 CVE-2024-23111 (6.8 medium) FortiOS/FortiProxy - XSS in reboot page
  • FG-IR-23-495 CVE-2023-23775 (6.5 medium) FortiSOAR is vulnerable to sql injection in Event Auth API via uuid parameter
  • FG-IR-23-460 CVE-2024-23110 (7.8 high) Multiple buffer overflows in diag npu command
  • FG-IR-23-356 CVE-2023-46720 (6.7 medium) Stack buffer overflow on bluetooth write feature
  • FG-IR-24-170 TunnelVision - CVE-2024-3661 (5.0 medium) (See Leviathan Security analysis: TunnelVision (CVE-2024-3661): How Attackers Can Decloak Routing-Based VPNs For a Total VPN Leak for more information on #TunnelVision, VPN bypass technique)
  • FG-IR-23-423 CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file

No mention of exploitation. Let the Patch Tuesday madness begin!

#PatchTuesday #vulnerability #Fortinet #CVE

CVE-2024-23282(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T09:32:46

2 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5, watchOS 10.5, iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, iOS 16.7.8 and iPadOS 16.7.8. A maliciously crafted email may be able to initiate FaceTime calls without user authorization.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T12:36:08.000Z ##

One of the disclosed Apple vulnerabilities in macOS Sonoma 14.5 from yesterday 10 June 2024 has the wildest impact:

CVE-2024-23282: A maliciously crafted email may be able to initiate FaceTime calls without user authorization

Reminds me of this Twitter gem (see attached image)

Also the vulnerability submitter said this:

This bug can leak user data on iOS even when Lockdown Mode is enabled! While Lockdown Mode blocks incoming FaceTime calls, it cannot block outgoing FaceTime calls.

This is very easy to exploit and is reliable.

#CVE_2024_23282 #Apple #CVE #vulnerability

##
pancake@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T10:43:13.000Z ##

âCVE-2024-23282 : A maliciously crafted email may be able to initiate FaceTime calls without user authorizationâ

##

CVE-2024-29855
(9.0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-11T06:31:53

6 posts

Hard-coded JWT secret allows authentication bypass in Veeam Recovery Orchestrator

1 repos

https://github.com/sinsinology/CVE-2024-29855

screaminggoat at 2024-06-15T15:53:58.034Z ##

Summoning Team: There Are No Secrets || Exploiting Veeam CVE-2024-29855
@SinSinology of Summoning Team provides a full analysis and exploit for CVE-2024-29855 (9.0 critical, see parent toot above for details/security advisory). Proof of concept

This vulenrability [sic] is due to the fact that JWT secret used to generate authentication tokens was a hardcoded value which means an unauthenticated attacker can generate valid tokens for any user (not just the administrator) and login to the Veeam Recovery Orchestrator.

#Veeam #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_29855 #CVE #proofofconcept #poc

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-06-13T17:40:05.000Z ##

Exploit for Veeam Recovery Orchestrator auth bypass available, patch now

A proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for a critical Veeam Recovery Orchestrator authentication bypass vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-29855 has been...

ðï¸ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/qlau27

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T13:07:48.770Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Veeam Recovery Orchestrator Vulnerability (CVE-2024-29855)
CVE-2024-29855 (9.0 critical, disclosed 10 June 2024 by Veeam) Hard-coded JWT secret allows authentication bypass in Veeam Recovery Orchestrator

Note: The attacker must know the exact username and role of an account that has an active VRO UI access token to accomplish the hijack.

Affects version 7.0.0.337. Resolved in versions 7.1.0.230 and 7.0.0.379. No mention of exploitation.

#Veeam #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_29855 #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-15T15:53:58.000Z ##

Summoning Team: There Are No Secrets || Exploiting Veeam CVE-2024-29855
@SinSinology of Summoning Team provides a full analysis and exploit for CVE-2024-29855 (9.0 critical, see parent toot above for details/security advisory). Proof of concept

This vulenrability [sic] is due to the fact that JWT secret used to generate authentication tokens was a hardcoded value which means an unauthenticated attacker can generate valid tokens for any user (not just the administrator) and login to the Veeam Recovery Orchestrator.

#Veeam #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_29855 #CVE #proofofconcept #poc

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-06-13T17:40:05.000Z ##

Exploit for Veeam Recovery Orchestrator auth bypass available, patch now

A proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for a critical Veeam Recovery Orchestrator authentication bypass vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-29855 has been...

ðï¸ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/qlau27

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-12T13:07:48.000Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Veeam Recovery Orchestrator Vulnerability (CVE-2024-29855)
CVE-2024-29855 (9.0 critical, disclosed 10 June 2024 by Veeam) Hard-coded JWT secret allows authentication bypass in Veeam Recovery Orchestrator

Note: The attacker must know the exact username and role of an account that has an active VRO UI access token to accomplish the hijack.

Affects version 7.0.0.337. Resolved in versions 7.1.0.230 and 7.0.0.379. No mention of exploitation.

#Veeam #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_29855 #CVE

##

CVE-2024-2961(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-10T18:31:59

3 posts

The iconv() function in the GNU C Library versions 2.39 and older may overflow the output buffer passed to it by up to 4 bytes when converting strings to the ISO-2022-CN-EXT character set, which may be used to crash an application or overwrite a neighbouring variable.

7 repos

https://github.com/kjdfklha/CVE-2024-2961_poc

https://github.com/mattaperkins/FIX-CVE-2024-2961

https://github.com/tnishiox/cve-2024-2961

https://github.com/exfil0/test_iconv

https://github.com/absolutedesignltd/iconvfix

https://github.com/ambionics/cnext-exploits

https://github.com/rvizx/CVE-2024-2961

patchnow24x7 at 2024-06-21T07:29:29.016Z ##

##

CVE-2023-50387
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 5.00%

updated 2024-06-10T18:31:57

1 posts

Certain DNSSEC aspects of the DNS protocol (in RFC 4035 and related RFCs) allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via one or more DNSSEC responses when there is a zone with many DNSKEY and RRSIG records, aka the "KeyTrap" issue. The protocol specification implies that an algorithm must evaluate all combinations of DNSKEY and RRSIG records.

2 repos

https://github.com/Meirelez/SSR-DNSSEC

https://github.com/knqyf263/CVE-2023-50387

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.000Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-37051
(9.3 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-06-10T18:31:15

2 posts

GitHub access token could be exposed to third-party sites in JetBrains IDEs after version 2023.1 and less than: IntelliJ IDEA 2023.1.7, 2023.2.7, 2023.3.7, 2024.1.3, 2024.2 EAP3; Aqua 2024.1.2; CLion 2023.1.7, 2023.2.4, 2023.3.5, 2024.1.3, 2024.2 EAP2; DataGrip 2023.1.3, 2023.2.4, 2023.3.5, 2024.1.4; DataSpell 2023.1.6, 2023.2.7, 2023.3.6, 2024.1.2, 2024.2 EAP1; GoLand 2023.1.6, 2023.2.7, 2023.3.7

2 repos

https://github.com/LeadroyaL/CVE-2024-37051-EXP

https://github.com/mrblackstar26/CVE-2024-37051

screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T19:05:26.918Z ##

JetBrains security advisory: Updates for security issue affecting IntelliJ-based IDEs 2023.1+ and JetBrains GitHub Plugin
A new security issue was discovered that affects the JetBrains GitHub plugin on the IntelliJ Platform, which could lead to disclosure of access tokens to third-party sites. CVE-2024-37051 (CVSSv3: 9.3 CRITICAL) GitHub access token could be exposed to third-party sites in JetBrains IDEs. No mention of exploitation.

h/t: @serghei See related Bleeping Computer reporting: JetBrains warns of IntelliJ IDE bug exposing GitHub access tokens

#CVE_2024_37051 #JetBrains #IntelliJ #GitHub

Deserialization of untrusted data can occur in the R statistical programming language, on any version starting at 1.4.0 up to and not including 4.4.0, enabling a maliciously crafted RDS (R Data Serialization) formatted file or R package to run arbitrary code on an end userâs system when interacted with.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.000Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T17:13:37.000Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Microsoft: 51 vulnerabilities, one is publicly disclosed:
MITRE: CVE-2023-50868 (7.5 high) NSEC3 closest encloser proof can exhaust CPU. CVE-2023-50868 is regarding a vulnerability in DNSSEC validation where an attacker could exploit standard DNSSEC protocols intended for DNS integrity by using excessive resources on a resolver, causing a denial of service for legitimate users. MITRE created this CVE on their behalf.

If you consider a publicly disclosed vulnerability a zero-day, that's the takeaway for Microsoft releases. No mention of exploitation for everything else. Checked against the actual MSRC Security Update Guide: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability

cc: @regnil @cR0w @bschwifty @arinc629 @Cali @wvu @hrbrmstr @avoidthehack @bieberium (make sure to remove all the mentions to avoid ReplyAll madness)

#PatchTuesday #Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2023_50868

##

CVE-2024-23692
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.21%

updated 2024-06-07T18:30:37

1 posts

Rejetto HTTP File Server, up to and including version 2.3m, is vulnerable to a template injection vulnerability. This vulnerability allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the affected system by sending a specially crafted HTTP request. As of the CVE assignment date, Rejetto HFS 2.3m is no longer supported.

Nuclei template

CVE-2024-28995
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 34.34%

updated 2024-06-06T09:30:52

23 posts

SolarWinds Serv-U was susceptible to a directory transversal vulnerability that would allow access to read sensitive files on the host machine.

Nuclei template

6 repos

https://github.com/bigb0x/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/ggfzx/CVE-2024-28995

https://github.com/huseyinstif/CVE-2024-28995-Nuclei-Template

screaminggoat at 2024-06-20T16:04:26.334Z ##

Centre for Cybersecurity of Belgium (CCB): WARNING: SOLARWINDS HAS RELEASED A HOTFIX FOR CVE-2024-28995, A HIGH SEVERITY DIRECTORY TRANSVERSAL VULNERABILITY IN ALL OF THEIR SERV-U PRODUCTS, PATCH IMMEDIATELY!
CCB's Twitter post indicates that CVE-2024-28995 (see parent toots above for more information) is actively being exploited.

#eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_28995 #SolarWinds

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-19T02:26:15.539Z ##

GreyNoise: SolarWinds Serv-U (CVE-2024-28995) exploitation: We see you!
GreyNoise analyzes exploitation attempts against their experimental honeypots that appear vulnerable to the SolarWinds Serv-U path-traversal vulnerability CVE-2024-28995 (see parent toots above for more info). Very interesting read to see threat actors' operational mistakes and determine whether it was an actual human being performing hands on keyboard activity. IOC are scattered throughout blog post.

#CVE_2024_28995 #CVE #vulnerability #solarwinds #activeexploitation #eitw

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-15T16:00:15.082Z ##

The Hacker Wire: Testing and Exploiting SolarWinds Serv-U (CVE-2024-28995) Vulnerability
Check out parent toots above for more security advisory and other contextual information about CVE-2024-28995

Exploiting CVE-2024-28995 flaw dose not require any authentication, complex payloads or interactions â just prior knowledge of the target file's path. An attacker can use something as simple as a web browser or curl to make the malicious HTTP request and disclose files.
The only limiting factor is whether the Serv-U service account has read access to the desired file path. By brute-forcing common file paths, an attacker could potentially map out a significant portion of the target's data.

A Proof of Concept bulk scanning utility was written in Python, and "allows checking multiple IPs or file paths in more efficient way."

cc: @reverseics @cR0w

#CVE_2024_28995 #CVE #vulnerability #solarwinds #proofofconcept #poc

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-11T14:36:54.081Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-28995: Trivially Exploitable Information Disclosure Vulnerability in SolarWinds Serv-U
See parent toot above for more information on CVE-2024-28995. Rapid7's vulnerability research team has reproduced the vulnerability and confirmed that it's trivially exploitable and allows an external unauthenticated attacker to read any file on disk, including binary files, so long as they know the path and the file is not locked (i.e., opened exclusively by something else). Rapid7 expects CVE-2024-28995 to be exploited in the wild soon.

cc: @reverseics @cR0w

#CVE_2024_28995 #CVE #vulnerability #solarwinds

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-20T16:04:26.000Z ##

screaminggoat at 2024-06-15T16:00:15.082Z ##

The Hacker Wire: Testing and Exploiting SolarWinds Serv-U (CVE-2024-28995) Vulnerability
Check out parent toots above for more security advisory and other contextual information about CVE-2024-28995

Exploiting CVE-2024-28995 flaw dose not require any authentication, complex payloads or interactions â just prior knowledge of the target file's path. An attacker can use something as simple as a web browser or curl to make the malicious HTTP request and disclose files.
The only limiting factor is whether the Serv-U service account has read access to the desired file path. By brute-forcing common file paths, an attacker could potentially map out a significant portion of the target's data.

A Proof of Concept bulk scanning utility was written in Python, and "allows checking multiple IPs or file paths in more efficient way."

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T18:47:02.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-0757(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-04T06:30:43

2 posts

The Insert or Embed Articulate Content into WordPress plugin through 4.3000000023 is not properly filtering which file extensions are allowed to be imported on the server, allowing the uploading of malicious code within zip files

1 repos

https://github.com/hunThubSpace/CVE-2024-0757-Exploit

DarkWebInformer at 2024-06-18T17:10:02.756Z ##

ð¨POC RELEASEDð¨A PoC Exploit for CVE-2024-0757 - Insert or Embed Articulate Content into WordPress Remote Code Execution (RCE)

The Insert or Embed Articulate Content into WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary file uploads through insecure file uploads in a zip archive in all versions up to, and including, 4.3000000023. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to upload zip files containing phar files on the affected site's server which may make remote code execution possible.

CVSS: 8.8 (High) [CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H]
Software Type: Plugin
Software Slug: insert-or-embed-articulate-content-into-wordpress
Affected Version: <= 4.3000000023

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1803111898163920900

https://github.com/hunThubSpace/CVE-2024-0757-Exploit

Horizon3: CVE-2024-29824 Deep Dive: Ivanti EPM SQL Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
Horizon3 provides a deep dive for CVE-2024-29824 (9.6 critical, disclosed 21 May 2024 by Ivanti) SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM. Horizon3 relied on the ZDI advisory to look for the function RecordGoodApp, and walked us through how to trigger the vulnerable function. They explain what an indicator of compromise would appear as. ##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T18:40:41.000Z ##

Summoning Team: Bypassing Veeam Authentication CVE-2024-29849
Summoning Team has a full analysis and proof of concept exploit code for CVE-2024-29849 (9.8 critical, disclosed 21 May 2024 by Veeam) authentication bypass in Veeam Backup & Replication.

Why you should worry about CVE-2024-29849:
Veeam Backup & Replication has three exploited vulnerabilities that made it to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-27532 (7.5 high) Missing Authentication: disclosed 10 March 2023, added 22 August 2023 (5 months)
  • CVE-2022-26501 (9.8 critical) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)
  • CVE-2022-26500 (8.8 high) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)

All three of these were known to be used in ransomware campaigns.

#CVE_2024_29849 #Veeam #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #PoC

CVE-2024-3661
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-05-18T05:03:51

1 posts

By design, the DHCP protocol does not authenticate messages, including for example the classless static route option (121). An attacker with the ability to send DHCP messages can manipulate routes to redirect VPN traffic, allowing the attacker to read, disrupt, or possibly modify network traffic that was expected to be protected by the VPN. Many, if not most VPN systems based on IP routing are sus

1 repos

https://github.com/a1xbit/DecloakingVPN

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T15:02:03.000Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-24-128 CVE-2024-31495 (4.3 medium) Blind SQL Injection
  • FG-IR-24-036 CVE-2024-26010 (7.5 high) Buffer overflow in fgfmd
  • FG-IR-23-471 CVE-2024-23111 (6.8 medium) FortiOS/FortiProxy - XSS in reboot page
  • FG-IR-23-495 CVE-2023-23775 (6.5 medium) FortiSOAR is vulnerable to sql injection in Event Auth API via uuid parameter
  • FG-IR-23-460 CVE-2024-23110 (7.8 high) Multiple buffer overflows in diag npu command
  • FG-IR-23-356 CVE-2023-46720 (6.7 medium) Stack buffer overflow on bluetooth write feature
  • FG-IR-24-170 TunnelVision - CVE-2024-3661 (5.0 medium) (See Leviathan Security analysis: TunnelVision (CVE-2024-3661): How Attackers Can Decloak Routing-Based VPNs For a Total VPN Leak for more information on #TunnelVision, VPN bypass technique)
  • FG-IR-23-423 CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file

No mention of exploitation. Let the Patch Tuesday madness begin!

#PatchTuesday #vulnerability #Fortinet #CVE

This advisory also provides guidance on what developers can do to update their applications to remove this vulnerability. A Remote Code Execution vulnerabil

screaminggoat at 2024-06-19T22:15:12.495Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) updated the security advisory for CVE-2024-30045 (6.3 medium, disclosed 14 May 2024 (Patch Tuesday)) .NET and Visual Studio Remote Code Execution Vulnerability for the following reason:

Revised the Security Updates table to include PowerShell 7.4 because this version of PowerShell 7 is affected by this vulnerability. See https://github.com/PowerShell/Announcements/issues/62 for more information.

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. Normally I wouldn't mention an older vulnerability but it's a slow news day and they did update this.

#CVE_2024_30045 #MSRC #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE

updated 2024-05-10T16:31:56

2 posts

An issue was discovered in gradio-app/gradio, where the `/component_server` endpoint improperly allows the invocation of any method on a `Component` class with attacker-controlled arguments. Specifically, by exploiting the `move_resource_to_block_cache()` method of the `Block` class, an attacker can copy any file on the filesystem to a temporary directory and subsequently retrieve it. This vulnera

screaminggoat at 2024-06-14T13:44:26.859Z ##

Horizon3a: Exploiting File Read Vulnerabilities in Gradio to Steal Secrets from Hugging Face Spaces
Horizon3 describes file read vulnerabilities CVE-2023-51449 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-1561 (7.5 high) in Gradio. They provide nuclei templates for testing. both vulnerabilities can be used to read arbitrary files from a server hosting Gradio. They stated their work with Hugging Face to harden the Spaces platform after the reported potential breach.

#CVE_2023_51449 #CVE_2024_1561 #Gradio #HuggingFace

##

CVE-2024-34470(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-05-06T15:30:48

2 posts

An issue was discovered in HSC Mailinspector 5.2.17-3 through v.5.2.18. An Unauthenticated Path Traversal vulnerability exists in the /public/loader.php file. The path parameter does not properly filter whether the file and directory passed are part of the webroot, allowing an attacker to read arbitrary files on the server.

Nuclei template

4 repos

https://github.com/Mr-r00t11/CVE-2024-34470

https://github.com/bigb0x/CVE-2024-34470

https://github.com/osvaldotenorio/CVE-2024-34470

https://github.com/Cappricio-Securities/CVE-2024-34470

DarkWebInformer at 2024-06-20T21:43:16.554Z ##

ð¨POC RELEASEDð¨CVE-2024-34470 "A critical vulnerability has been found in HSC Mailinspector up to version 5.2.18. This vulnerability affects an unknown functionality of the file /public/loader.php. Manipulating the 'path' argument with an unknown input leads to a path traversal vulnerability. According to CWE, this issue is classified as CWE-22.

The product uses external input to construct a pathname intended to identify a file or directory located beneath a restricted parent directory, but the product does not properly neutralize special elements within the pathname that can cause the pathname to resolve to a location outside of the restricted directory. This affects confidentiality, integrity, and availability."

https://github.com/Mr-r00t11/CVE-2024-34470

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1803905811229352212

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-20T21:43:16.000Z ##

ð¨POC RELEASEDð¨CVE-2024-34470 "A critical vulnerability has been found in HSC Mailinspector up to version 5.2.18. This vulnerability affects an unknown functionality of the file /public/loader.php. Manipulating the 'path' argument with an unknown input leads to a path traversal vulnerability. According to CWE, this issue is classified as CWE-22.

The product uses external input to construct a pathname intended to identify a file or directory located beneath a restricted parent directory, but the product does not properly neutralize special elements within the pathname that can cause the pathname to resolve to a location outside of the restricted directory. This affects confidentiality, integrity, and availability."

https://github.com/Mr-r00t11/CVE-2024-34470

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1803905811229352212

CVE-2024-21378

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-04-21T05:02:41

4 posts

Microsoft Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/d0rb/CVE-2024-21378

screaminggoat at 2024-06-21T14:36:22.986Z ##

NetSPI: CVE-2024-21378 â Remote Code Execution in Microsoft Outlook
NetSPI provides vulnerability details and a proof of concept for CVE-2024-21378 (8.8 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft) Outlook Remote Code Execution Vulnerability via synced form objects. They covered how CVE-2024-21378 was discovered and weaponized it by modifying the Outlook pentesting tool "Ruler." A pull request containing the proof of concept is provided on GitHub.

Due to the renewed interest in Outlook RCE (see parent toot above), people on Twitter are resharing CVE-2024-21378.

#CVE_2024_21378 #Outlook #RCE #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft

In Spring Security, versions 5.7.x prior to 5.7.12, 5.8.x prior to 5.8.11, versions 6.0.x prior to 6.0.9, versions 6.1.x prior to 6.1.8, versions 6.2.x prior to 6.2.3, an application is possible vulnerable to broken access control when it directly uses the AuthenticatedVoter#vote passing a null Authentication parameter. Specifically, an application is vulnerable if: The application uses Authenti

jbhall56 at 2024-06-20T11:45:01.062Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-22257, the most severe of these flaws is a broken access control issue in the Spring Framework that could allow unauthenticated attackers to expose assets they should not have access to. https://www.securityweek.com/atlassian-patches-high-severity-vulnerabilities-in-confluence-crucible-jira/

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-06-20T07:51:20.337Z ##

Security Bulletin: Atlassian June 2024

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-22257
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-918]], [[CWE-400]]
Sources: Atlassian Documentation, NVD

Synopsis

Atlassian has released a security bulletin addressing multiple high-severity vulnerabilities in its products. These vulnerabilities, discovered through the company's Bug Bounty program and third-party scans, have been fixed in recent versions.

Issue Summary

Nine high-severity vulnerabilities affecting various Atlassian products were disclosed. These vulnerabilities include issues such as improper authorization and server-side request forgery (SSRF) in dependencies like org.springframework.security:spring-security-core and org.springframework:spring-web. Confluence, Jira, and Fisheye/Crucible are among the affected products.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve improper authorization and SSRF, which allow attackers to exploit insufficient validation of user inputs. For instance, CVE-2024-22257 involves improper authorization due to flaws in the org.springframework.security:spring-security-core dependency, potentially leading to unauthorized access.

Vulnerable Products

  • Confluence Data Center and Server: Versions 8.9.0 to 8.9.2, 8.8.0 to 8.8.1, 8.7.1 to 8.7.2, among others.
  • Fisheye/Crucible: Versions 4.8.10 to 4.8.14.
  • Jira Data Center and Server: Versions 9.12.0 to 9.12.7 (LTS), 9.4.0 to 9.4.20 (LTS).
  • Jira Service Management: Versions 5.15.2, 5.12.0 to 5.12.7 (LTS).

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities could lead to unauthorized access, denial of service (DoS), or information disclosure, significantly impacting the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the affected systems.

Patches or Workaround

Patches have been released for the affected products. Users are advised to update to the latest versions or apply the recommended fixed versions listed in the bulletin. No temporary mitigations are provided; hence, immediate patching is crucial.

Tags

#Atlassian #CVE-2024-22257 #ImproperAuthorization #SSRF #DoS #Confluence #Jira #SecurityBulletin #Vulnerability

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-20T11:45:01.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-22257, the most severe of these flaws is a broken access control issue in the Spring Framework that could allow unauthenticated attackers to expose assets they should not have access to. https://www.securityweek.com/atlassian-patches-high-severity-vulnerabilities-in-confluence-crucible-jira/

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-20T07:51:20.000Z ##

Security Bulletin: Atlassian June 2024

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-22257
Vulnerability Type: Improper Authorization
CWE: [[CWE-284]], [[CWE-918]], [[CWE-400]]
Sources: Atlassian Documentation, NVD

Synopsis

Atlassian has released a security bulletin addressing multiple high-severity vulnerabilities in its products. These vulnerabilities, discovered through the company's Bug Bounty program and third-party scans, have been fixed in recent versions.

Issue Summary

Nine high-severity vulnerabilities affecting various Atlassian products were disclosed. These vulnerabilities include issues such as improper authorization and server-side request forgery (SSRF) in dependencies like org.springframework.security:spring-security-core and org.springframework:spring-web. Confluence, Jira, and Fisheye/Crucible are among the affected products.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve improper authorization and SSRF, which allow attackers to exploit insufficient validation of user inputs. For instance, CVE-2024-22257 involves improper authorization due to flaws in the org.springframework.security:spring-security-core dependency, potentially leading to unauthorized access.

Vulnerable Products

  • Confluence Data Center and Server: Versions 8.9.0 to 8.9.2, 8.8.0 to 8.8.1, 8.7.1 to 8.7.2, among others.
  • Fisheye/Crucible: Versions 4.8.10 to 4.8.14.
  • Jira Data Center and Server: Versions 9.12.0 to 9.12.7 (LTS), 9.4.0 to 9.4.20 (LTS).
  • Jira Service Management: Versions 5.15.2, 5.12.0 to 5.12.7 (LTS).

Impact Assessment

Exploiting these vulnerabilities could lead to unauthorized access, denial of service (DoS), or information disclosure, significantly impacting the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the affected systems.

Patches or Workaround

Patches have been released for the affected products. Users are advised to update to the latest versions or apply the recommended fixed versions listed in the bulletin. No temporary mitigations are provided; hence, immediate patching is crucial.

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog (link might not work)
Hot off the press! CISA adds three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-32896 Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-26169 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Error Reporting Service Improper Privilege Management Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-4358 (9.8 critical) Progress Telerik Report Server Authentication Bypass by Spoofing Vulnerability

##
jbhall56 at 2024-06-12T12:12:12.086Z ##

The security flaw in question is CVE-2024-26169 (CVSS score: 7.8), an elevation of privilege bug in the Windows Error Reporting Service that could be exploited to achieve SYSTEM privileges. It was patched by Microsoft in March 2024. https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/black-basta-ransomware-may-have.html

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T11:52:50.390Z ##

Symantec: Ransomware Attackers May Have Used Privilege Escalation Vulnerability as Zero-day
Symantec assesses that the financially motivated Cardinal group (aka Storm-1811, UNC4393) may have CVE-2024-26169 (7.8 high, disclosed 12 March 2024 by Microsoft) Windows Error Reporting Service Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability as a zero day before it was publicly known and patched. Symantec notes that this group deploys Black Basta ransomware.

The variant of the tool used in this attack ... had a compilation time stamp of February 27, 2024, several weeks before the vulnerability was patched.
A second variant of the tool discovered on Virus Total ... had an earlier compilation time stamp of December 18, 2023.

Symantec provides IOC.

#CVE_2024_26169 #eitw #CVE #activeexploitation #vulnerability #zeroday #threatintel #IOC #ransomware #BlackBasta #Cardinal #Storm1811 #UNC4393

##

CVE-2019-6693
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-04-11T21:02:46

2 posts

Use of a hard-coded cryptographic key to cipher sensitive data in FortiOS configuration backup file may allow an attacker with access to the backup file to decipher the sensitive data, via knowledge of the hard-coded key. The aforementioned sensitive data includes users' passwords (except the administrator's password), private keys' passphrases and High Availability password (when set).

3 repos

https://github.com/saladandonionrings/cve-2019-6693

https://github.com/synacktiv/CVE-2020-9289

https://github.com/gquere/CVE-2019-6693

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T21:43:30.870Z ##

G DATA Advanced Analytics: Give Me Your FortiGate Configuration Backup and I Rule Your Network
G DATA reveals vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file in FortiOS and FortiProxy. (See parent toot above for more information) Their analysis implies that either CVE-2024-21754 or CVE-2019-6693 were exploited in a security incident that they were investigating: "attackers were able to authenticate to the VPN... these connections have been authorized by the guest account." cc: @todb
The root cause for CVE-2024-21754: "The problem with this implementation is the single hashing round."

h/t: @campuscodi

#CVE_2024_21754 #CVE_2019_6693 #Fortinet #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T21:43:30.000Z ##

G DATA Advanced Analytics: Give Me Your FortiGate Configuration Backup and I Rule Your Network
G DATA reveals vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21754 (1.8 low) Weak key derivation for backup file in FortiOS and FortiProxy. (See parent toot above for more information) Their analysis implies that either CVE-2024-21754 or CVE-2019-6693 were exploited in a security incident that they were investigating: "attackers were able to authenticate to the VPN... these connections have been authorized by the guest account." cc: @todb
The root cause for CVE-2024-21754: "The problem with this implementation is the single hashing round."

h/t: @campuscodi

GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-06-11T15:10:47.000Z ##

Curious one - it looks like somebody deleted or disabled the Github account for Varwara, who releases exploits for primarily Microsoft software, HT @RonnyTNL

Yesterday he released an exploit for CVE-2024-26229 in CSC driver in Windows, it was here: https://github.com/varwara/CVE-2024-26229

Now their account is gone: https://github.com/varwara/

CVE-2024-20693
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-09T18:30:25

4 posts

Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-06-15T15:36:11.095Z ##

Sector7: CVE-2024-20693: Windows cached code signature manipulation
I understand that vendors don't want to share information about vulnerabilities to the point where threat actors understand new attack vectors or variations of severe flaws. But when CVE-2024-20693 (7.8 high, disclosed 09 April 2024) is labeled "Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability," it looks like all of the other vulnerabilities with generalized titles and no description.
Sector7 reported CVE-2024-20693, which allows for manipulating the cached signature signing level of an executable or DLL. They describe how they discovered this issue and its impact. To be honest, there's no way to paraphrase this article or provide a concise summary. I would end up leaving an important detail out. They started with the presentation from @maddiestone and @tiraniddo The Print Spooler Bug that Wasnât in the Print Spooler at OffensiveCon 2023 to undstand privilege escalation using an impersonated device map and isolation-aware DLLs. The mitigation from Microsoft was not thorough enough, and a lot of privileged services were left with the same issue. They found wscsvc.dll and got sidetracked into finding a signature bypass of Windows DLL files. I'm trying to understand their thought process at a glance, but they've written it as a walkthrough to elevate privileges, bypass WDAC and inject code into protected processes. They plan out a scenario where a user opens a downloaded file (leveraging an unrelated Mark-of-the-Web bypass vulnerability) to full system compromise. Video demonstrates proof of concept.
Sector7 notes that Microsoft didn't fix the problem directly but fixed the instances that were exploited. The timeline also shows Microsoft Security Response Center taking 8 months to resolve a confirmed vulnerability that they successfully reproduced, and that the Microsoft Bounty Team disagreeing 1 month afterward on awarding a bounty.

#CVE_2024_20693 #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #eop

##
sector7 at 2024-06-14T11:47:18.799Z ##

We've published our writeup of CVE-2024-20693, a vulnerability in Windows that allowed spoofing the code signature of binaries by placing them on an SMB share. This research originally was about something different, but we ran into a signature check...

https://sector7.computest.nl/post/2024-06-cve-2024-20693-windows-cached-code-signature-manipulation/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-15T15:36:11.000Z ##

Sector7: CVE-2024-20693: Windows cached code signature manipulation
I understand that vendors don't want to share information about vulnerabilities to the point where threat actors understand new attack vectors or variations of severe flaws. But when CVE-2024-20693 (7.8 high, disclosed 09 April 2024) is labeled "Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability," it looks like all of the other vulnerabilities with generalized titles and no description.
Sector7 reported CVE-2024-20693, which allows for manipulating the cached signature signing level of an executable or DLL. They describe how they discovered this issue and its impact. To be honest, there's no way to paraphrase this article or provide a concise summary. I would end up leaving an important detail out. They started with the presentation from @maddiestone and @tiraniddo The Print Spooler Bug that Wasnât in the Print Spooler at OffensiveCon 2023 to undstand privilege escalation using an impersonated device map and isolation-aware DLLs. The mitigation from Microsoft was not thorough enough, and a lot of privileged services were left with the same issue. They found wscsvc.dll and got sidetracked into finding a signature bypass of Windows DLL files. I'm trying to understand their thought process at a glance, but they've written it as a walkthrough to elevate privileges, bypass WDAC and inject code into protected processes. They plan out a scenario where a user opens a downloaded file (leveraging an unrelated Mark-of-the-Web bypass vulnerability) to full system compromise. Video demonstrates proof of concept.
Sector7 notes that Microsoft didn't fix the problem directly but fixed the instances that were exploited. The timeline also shows Microsoft Security Response Center taking 8 months to resolve a confirmed vulnerability that they successfully reproduced, and that the Microsoft Bounty Team disagreeing 1 month afterward on awarding a bounty.

CVE-2024-29748
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-04-08T22:52:33.780000

2 posts

there is a possible way to bypass due to a logic error in the code. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T15:58:35.754Z ##

@jgreig According to GrapheneOS, CVE-2024-32896 is the 2nd part of the fix for the CVE-2024-29748 vulnerability actively exploited in the wild by forensic companies: https://grapheneos.social/@GrapheneOS/112609239806949074 h/t @caspicat cc: @jwarminsky

And that CVE-2024-32896 is not Pixel-specific

##

CVE-2023-20867
(3.9 LOW)

EPSS: 0.16%

updated 2024-04-04T04:47:29

2 posts

A fully compromised ESXi host can force VMware Tools to fail to authenticate host-to-guest operations, impacting the confidentiality and integrity of the guest virtual machine.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-19T02:12:17.940Z ##

Mandiant: Cloaked and Covert: Uncovering UNC3886 Espionage Operations
Mandiant blogs about the Chinese state-sponsored espionage actor UNC3886. They discuess UNC3886's intrusion path and subsequent actions that were performed in the environments after compromising the guest virtual machines to achieve access to the critical systems, including:

  • The use of publicly available rootkits for long-term persistence
  • Deployment of malware that leveraged trusted third-party services for C2
  • Subverting access and collecting credentials with Secure Shell (SSH) backdoors
  • Extracting credentials from TACACS+ authentication using custom malware

Vulnerabilities exploited by UNC3886 include CVE-2023-34048, CVE-2022-41328, CVE-2022-22948 (surprisingly not in the KEV Catalog cc: @todb) and CVE-2023-20867. The TACACS+ section is really informative and interesting. IOC and Yara rules provided.

#threatintel #UNC3886 #china #cyberespionage #CVE_2022_41328 #CVE_2023_34048 #CVE_2022_22948 #CVE_2023_20867 #IOC #Yara

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-19T02:12:17.000Z ##

Mandiant blogs about the Chinese state-sponsored espionage actor UNC3886. They discuess UNC3886's intrusion path and subsequent actions that were performed in the environments after compromising the guest virtual machines to achieve access to the critical systems, including:

  • The use of publicly available rootkits for long-term persistence
  • Deployment of malware that leveraged trusted third-party services for C2
  • Subverting access and collecting credentials with Secure Shell (SSH) backdoors
  • Extracting credentials from TACACS+ authentication using custom malware

Vulnerabilities exploited by UNC3886 include CVE-2023-34048, CVE-2022-41328, CVE-2022-22948 (surprisingly not in the KEV Catalog cc: @todb) and CVE-2023-20867. The TACACS+ section is really informative and interesting. IOC and Yara rules provided.

##

CVE-2023-38039
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.93%

updated 2024-04-01T18:30:56

2 posts

When curl retrieves an HTTP response, it stores the incoming headers so that they can be accessed later via the libcurl headers API. However, curl did not have a limit in how many or how large headers it would accept in a response, allowing a malicious server to stream an endless series of headers and eventually cause curl to run out of heap memory.

1 repos

https://github.com/Smartkeyss/CVE-2023-38039

bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-06-15T20:53:43.000Z ##

another insisted that you can make curl run out of memory by feeding it a long sequence of large HTTP headers. The exact problem we already fixed as a CVE last year (CVE-2023-38039). None of us could reproduce in a current version. Probably caused by a broken build by the reporter or something.

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-06-15T20:53:43.000Z ##

another insisted that you can make curl run out of memory by feeding it a long sequence of large HTTP headers. The exact problem we already fixed as a CVE last year (CVE-2023-38039). None of us could reproduce in a current version. Probably caused by a broken build by the reporter or something.

CVE-2024-2887(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-29T06:30:30

2 posts

Type Confusion in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 123.0.6312.86 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-06-14T11:21:17.170Z ##

Elastic security advisories:

  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update (ESA-2024-11) CVE-2024-23443 (4.9 medium) Kibana uncontrolled resource consumption (ESA-2024-11) A high-privileged user, allowed to create custom osquery packs 5 could affect the availability of Kibana by uploading a maliciously crafted osquery pack.
  • Kibana 8.14.0/7.17.22 Security Update CVE-2024-23442 (6.1 medium) Kibana open redirect issue (ESA-2024-10). An open redirect issue was discovered in Kibana that could lead to a user being redirected to an arbitrary website if they use a maliciously crafted Kibana URL.
  • Kibana 7.17.22 / 8.14.0 Security Update (ESA-2024-17) CVE-2024-2887 (9.9 critical) Kibana RCE due to chromium type confusion (ESA-2024-17) On March 26, 2024, a type confusion vulnerability was found in WebAssembly in Google Chrome version prior to 123.0.6312.86 which allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

No mention of exploitation.

#Elastic #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_23443 #CVE_2024_23442 #Kibana #CVE_2024_2887

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-08T03:31:32

2 posts

RAD SecFlow-2 devices with Hardware 0202, Firmware 4.1.01.63, and U-Boot 2010.12 allow URIs beginning with /.. for Directory Traversal, as demonstrated by reading /etc/shadow.

jbhall56 at 2024-06-19T12:07:59.216Z ##

The flaw has been assigned the identifier CVE-2019-6268, but no information appears to have been publicly available until early March 2024, when someone released technical details and a PoC on the Packet Storm website. https://www.securityweek.com/cisa-informs-organizations-of-vulnerability-in-rad-secflow-2-industrial-switch/

##

CVE-2024-25065(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-02-29T03:33:28

2 posts

Possible path traversal in Apache OFBiz allowing authentication bypass. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.12, that fixes the issue.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-21T14:43:49.905Z ##

SecureLayer7: Analysis of CVE-2024-25065: Apache OFBiz Security bypass
SecureLayer7 uses patch diffing to understand CVE-2024-25065 (CVSS score pending) path traversal in Apache OFBiz allowing authentication bypass. They perform static and dynamic analysis to walk the reader through the vulnerability. Proof of concept is not explicitly stated but is described in Exploitation.

By exploiting this vulnerability, attackers can gain unauthorized access to various functionalities and data within the application. To mitigate this issue, update to Apache OFBiz version 18.12.12 or later, where the vulnerability has been patched by normalizing the contextPath variable to ensure it is a valid URI.

h/t: @buherator cc: @reverseics

#CVE_2024_25065 #Apache #Ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-21T14:43:49.000Z ##

SecureLayer7: Analysis of CVE-2024-25065: Apache OFBiz Security bypass
SecureLayer7 uses patch diffing to understand CVE-2024-25065 (CVSS score pending) path traversal in Apache OFBiz allowing authentication bypass. They perform static and dynamic analysis to walk the reader through the vulnerability. Proof of concept is not explicitly stated but is described in Exploitation.

By exploiting this vulnerability, attackers can gain unauthorized access to various functionalities and data within the application. To mitigate this issue, update to Apache OFBiz version 18.12.12 or later, where the vulnerability has been patched by normalizing the contextPath variable to ensure it is a valid URI.

h/t: @buherator cc: @reverseics

CVE-2023-51449
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 3.08%

updated 2024-02-16T21:52:41

2 posts

Older versions of `gradio` contained a vulnerability in the `/file` route which made them susceptible to file traversal attacks in which an attacker could access arbitrary files on a machine running a Gradio app with a public URL (e.g. if the demo was created with `share=True`, or on Hugging Face Spaces) if they knew the path of files to look for. This was not possible through regular URLs passe

Nuclei template

screaminggoat at 2024-06-14T13:44:26.859Z ##

Horizon3a: Exploiting File Read Vulnerabilities in Gradio to Steal Secrets from Hugging Face Spaces
Horizon3 describes file read vulnerabilities CVE-2023-51449 (7.5 high) and CVE-2024-1561 (7.5 high) in Gradio. They provide nuclei templates for testing. both vulnerabilities can be used to read arbitrary files from a server hosting Gradio. They stated their work with Hugging Face to harden the Spaces platform after the reported potential breach.

#CVE_2023_51449 #CVE_2024_1561 #Gradio #HuggingFace

# Summary Log4j versions prior to 2.16.0 are subject to a remote code execution vulnerability via the ldap JNDI parser. As per [Apache's Log4j security guide](https://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/security.html): Apache Log4j2 <=2.14.1 JNDI features used in configuration, log messages, and parameters do not protect against attacker controlled LDAP and other JNDI related endpoints. screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T14:32:59.000Z ##

Imperva: Update: CVE-2024-4577 quickly weaponized to distribute "TellYouThePass" Ransomware
From as early as June 8th, Imperva detected attacker activity leveraging this CVE-2024-4577 to deliver malware, which we have now identified to be a part of the "TellYouThePass" ransomware campaign. (See parent toots above for more information on CVE-2024-4577). TellYouThePass is a ransomware that has been seen since 2019, targeting businesses and individuals, in a campaign for both Windows and Linux systems. It commonly leverages CVE-2021-44228 (Apache Log4j), and has also been seen using CVE-2023-46604, among others. Imperva described the attack vector, and has a technical analysis of the sample. IOC provided.

h/t: @BleepingComputer reporting: TellYouThePass ransomware exploits recent PHP RCE flaw to breach servers

#threatintel #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #ransomware #TellYouThePass #IOC

CVE-2023-34048
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 4.38%

updated 2024-01-31T05:07:15

4 posts

vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol.Â A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds write potentially leading to remote code execution.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-19T02:12:17.940Z ##

Mandiant: Cloaked and Covert: Uncovering UNC3886 Espionage Operations
Mandiant blogs about the Chinese state-sponsored espionage actor UNC3886. They discuess UNC3886's intrusion path and subsequent actions that were performed in the environments after compromising the guest virtual machines to achieve access to the critical systems, including:

  • The use of publicly available rootkits for long-term persistence
  • Deployment of malware that leveraged trusted third-party services for C2
  • Subverting access and collecting credentials with Secure Shell (SSH) backdoors
  • Extracting credentials from TACACS+ authentication using custom malware

Vulnerabilities exploited by UNC3886 include CVE-2023-34048, CVE-2022-41328, CVE-2022-22948 (surprisingly not in the KEV Catalog cc: @todb) and CVE-2023-20867. The TACACS+ section is really informative and interesting. IOC and Yara rules provided.

#threatintel #UNC3886 #china #cyberespionage #CVE_2022_41328 #CVE_2023_34048 #CVE_2022_22948 #CVE_2023_20867 #IOC #Yara

Mandiant blogs about the Chinese state-sponsored espionage actor UNC3886. They discuess UNC3886's intrusion path and subsequent actions that were performed in the environments after compromising the guest virtual machines to achieve access to the critical systems, including:

  • The use of publicly available rootkits for long-term persistence
  • Deployment of malware that leveraged trusted third-party services for C2
  • Subverting access and collecting credentials with Secure Shell (SSH) backdoors
  • Extracting credentials from TACACS+ authentication using custom malware

Vulnerabilities exploited by UNC3886 include CVE-2023-34048, CVE-2022-41328, CVE-2022-22948 (surprisingly not in the KEV Catalog cc: @todb) and CVE-2023-20867. The TACACS+ section is really informative and interesting. IOC and Yara rules provided.

##
H3liumb0y at 2024-06-18T10:02:44.955Z ##

Critical Vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081
Vulnerability Type: Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption
CWE: [[CWE-787]], [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-125]]
Sources: SecurityWeek, Cybersecurity News, Broadcom VMware advisory

Synopsis

Multiple critical vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server have been identified, potentially allowing remote code execution (RCE). These issues, detailed in VMware's security advisory VMSA-2024-0012, include CVE-2023-34048, which affects the DCE/RPC protocol implementation. The DCE/RPC (Distributed Computing Environment / Remote Procedure Call) protocol is a network protocol developed by the Open Group. It enables communication between client and server applications by allowing a program to request services from a program located on another computer within a network. DCE/RPC is based on the concept of remote procedure calls (RPC), which facilitate the execution of code on a remote system as if it were local.

Issue Summary

VMware vCenter Server, a key management component for VMware environments, contains several critical vulnerabilities. If exploited, these could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely. The most critical of these, CVE-2023-34048, has been rated with a CVSS score of 9.8, indicating high severity.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve memory corruption issues such as heap overflow and use-after-free errors in the DCE/RPC protocol. These can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the vCenter Server, leading to remote code execution and potential system compromise.

Vulnerable Products

  • vCenter Server 8.0
  • vCenter Server 7.0
  • VMware Cloud Foundation versions 4.x and 5.x

**Response Matrix:

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| ------------------ | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 8.0 U2d | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080 | 9.8, 9.8 | Critical | 8.0 U1e | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 7.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 7.0 U3r | None | FAQ |

**

Impacted Product Suites that Deploy Response Matrix 3a and 3b Components:

*

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| --------------------------------- | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 5.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 4.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |

Impact Assessment

Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could result in complete control over the affected systems, allowing attackers to perform any action, including data theft, service disruption, and further network compromise.

Patches or Workarounds

VMware has released patches to address these vulnerabilities. Administrators are advised to update to the fixed versions (8.0 U2d, 7.0 U3r) . There are no available workarounds.

Tags

#VMware #vCenterServer #CVE-2023-34048 #RemoteCodeExecution #PatchManagement #Cybersecurity

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-18T10:02:44.000Z ##

Critical Vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server

Date: June 18, 2024
CVE: CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081
Vulnerability Type: Buffer Overflow, Memory Corruption
CWE: [[CWE-787]], [[CWE-416]], [[CWE-125]]
Sources: SecurityWeek, Cybersecurity News, Broadcom VMware advisory

Synopsis

Multiple critical vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server have been identified, potentially allowing remote code execution (RCE). These issues, detailed in VMware's security advisory VMSA-2024-0012, include CVE-2023-34048, which affects the DCE/RPC protocol implementation. The DCE/RPC (Distributed Computing Environment / Remote Procedure Call) protocol is a network protocol developed by the Open Group. It enables communication between client and server applications by allowing a program to request services from a program located on another computer within a network. DCE/RPC is based on the concept of remote procedure calls (RPC), which facilitate the execution of code on a remote system as if it were local.

Issue Summary

VMware vCenter Server, a key management component for VMware environments, contains several critical vulnerabilities. If exploited, these could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely. The most critical of these, CVE-2023-34048, has been rated with a CVSS score of 9.8, indicating high severity.

Technical Key Findings

The vulnerabilities primarily involve memory corruption issues such as heap overflow and use-after-free errors in the DCE/RPC protocol. These can be exploited by sending specially crafted packets to the vCenter Server, leading to remote code execution and potential system compromise.

Vulnerable Products

  • vCenter Server 8.0
  • vCenter Server 7.0
  • VMware Cloud Foundation versions 4.x and 5.x

**Response Matrix:

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| ------------------ | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 8.0 U2d | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 8.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080 | 9.8, 9.8 | Critical | 8.0 U1e | None | FAQ |
| vCenter Server | 7.0 | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | 7.0 U3r | None | FAQ |

**

Impacted Product Suites that Deploy Response Matrix 3a and 3b Components:

*

| VMware Product | Version | Running On | CVE | CVSSv3 | Severity | Fixed Version | Workarounds | Additional Documentation |
| --------------------------------- | ----------- | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 5.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |
| Cloud Foundation (vCenter Server) | 4.x | Any | CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081 | 9.8, 9.8, 7.8 | Critical | KB88287 | None | FAQ |

Impact Assessment

Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could result in complete control over the affected systems, allowing attackers to perform any action, including data theft, service disruption, and further network compromise.

Patches or Workarounds

VMware has released patches to address these vulnerabilities. Administrators are advised to update to the fixed versions (8.0 U2d, 7.0 U3r) . There are no available workarounds.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T18:33:47.000Z ##

@dreadpir8robots good catch, I guess 50868 doesn't have a designer name (but is related)

cc: @shellsharks CVE-2023-50867 is actually #KeyTrap stead of 50868

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T17:21:35.000Z ##

CVE-2023-50868 (CVSSv3/4 score pending, disclosed 14 February 2024)

The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC 9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in a random subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specification implies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hash function in certain situations.

This vulnerability was actually discovered while testing mitigations for the KeyTrap vulnerability (CVE-2023-50867; cc: @shellsharks): BIND 9 Security Release and Multi-Vendor Vulnerability Handling, CVE-2023-50387 and CVE-2023-50868 h/t: @dreadpir8robots

An attacker either selects or creates a DNSSEC-signed zone with NSEC3 parameters configured in excess of the Best Current Practice RFC9276, primarily by using extra iterations, and then launches a random subdomain attack against this zone. Because this Best Practice document is not yet universally followed, resolvers typically accept the extra iterations and spend CPU cycles on SHA1 hashing.

These extra SHA1 hash iterations serve as another potential denial-of-service attack vector. Again, the relevant standard, RFC 5155 section 8.3, does not warn about this risk, and multiple implementations did not protect against it. Ironically, we discovered this flaw while testing mitigations for KeyTrap!

#CVE_2023_50868 #KeyTrap #CVE #vulnerability

##

CVE-2021-28663
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.63%

updated 2023-12-13T13:51:52.563000

1 posts

The Arm Mali GPU kernel driver allows privilege escalation or information disclosure because GPU memory operations are mishandled, leading to a use-after-free. This affects Bifrost r0p0 through r28p0 before r29p0, Valhall r19p0 through r28p0 before r29p0, and Midgard r4p0 through r30p0.

2 repos

https://github.com/lntrx/CVE-2021-28663

https://github.com/TAKIANFIF/CVE-2021-1905-CVE-2021-1906-CVE-2021-28663-CVE-2021-28664

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.000Z ##

Arm exploited zero-day: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
CVE-2024-4610 (CVSS score pending) Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

Arm is aware of reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild.

Why you should be worried about CVE-2024-4610: Multiple Arm Mali GPU drivers are in the KEV Catalog: CVE-2023-4211, CVE-2021-29256, CVE-2023-26083, CVE-2022-22706, CVE-2022-38181, CVE-2021-28664, and CVE-2021-28663!

h/t: @BleepingComputer Arm warns of actively exploited flaw in Mali GPU kernel drivers

#zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4610 #Arm #eitw

- CVE-2024-4603

busybox

- CVE-2023-42363
- CVE-2023-42364
- CVE-2023-42365
- CVE-2023-42366

See: https://alpinelinux.org/posts/Alpine-3.17.8-3.18.7-3.19.2-released.html

CVE-2023-46604
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 93.14%

updated 2023-11-28T22:24:39

1 posts

Apache ActiveMQ is vulnerable to Remote Code Execution.The vulnerability may allow a remote attacker with network access to a broker to run arbitrary shell commands by manipulating serialized class types in the OpenWire protocol to cause the broker to instantiateÂ any class on the classpath.Â  Users are recommended to upgrade to version 5.15.16, 5.16.7, 5.17.6, or 5.18.3, which fixes this issue.

Nuclei template

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T14:32:59.000Z ##

Imperva: Update: CVE-2024-4577 quickly weaponized to distribute "TellYouThePass" Ransomware
From as early as June 8th, Imperva detected attacker activity leveraging this CVE-2024-4577 to deliver malware, which we have now identified to be a part of the "TellYouThePass" ransomware campaign. (See parent toots above for more information on CVE-2024-4577). TellYouThePass is a ransomware that has been seen since 2019, targeting businesses and individuals, in a campaign for both Windows and Linux systems. It commonly leverages CVE-2021-44228 (Apache Log4j), and has also been seen using CVE-2023-46604, among others. Imperva described the attack vector, and has a technical analysis of the sample. IOC provided.

h/t: @BleepingComputer reporting: TellYouThePass ransomware exploits recent PHP RCE flaw to breach servers

#threatintel #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4577 #PHP #ransomware #TellYouThePass #IOC

##

CVE-2023-4211
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 21.26%

updated 2023-10-04T20:51:36.240000

1 posts

A local non-privileged user can make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T23:26:01.000Z ##

Arm exploited zero-day: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
CVE-2024-4610 (CVSS score pending) Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r34p0 through r40p0.

Arm is aware of reports of this vulnerability being exploited in the wild.

Why you should be worried about CVE-2024-4610: Multiple Arm Mali GPU drivers are in the KEV Catalog: CVE-2023-4211, CVE-2021-29256, CVE-2023-26083, CVE-2022-22706, CVE-2022-38181, CVE-2021-28664, and CVE-2021-28663!

h/t: @BleepingComputer Arm warns of actively exploited flaw in Mali GPU kernel drivers

#zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_4610 #Arm #eitw

CVE-2023-32681
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2023-09-17T09:15:12.327000

1 posts

Requests is a HTTP library. Since Requests 2.3.0, Requests has been leaking Proxy-Authorization headers to destination servers when redirected to an HTTPS endpoint. This is a product of how we use `rebuild_proxies` to reattach the `Proxy-Authorization` header to requests. For HTTP connections sent through the tunnel, the proxy will identify the header in the request itself and remove it prior to f

1 repos

https://github.com/hardikmodha/POC-CVE-2023-32681

Memory leak vulnerability in Mali GPU Kernel Driver in Midgard GPU Kernel Driver all versions from r6p0 - r32p0, Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver all versions from r0p0 - r42p0, Valhall GPU Kernel Driver all versions from r19p0 - r42p0, and Avalon GPU Kernel Driver all versions from r41p0 - r42p0 allows a non-privileged user to make valid GPU processing operations that expose sensitive kernel metadata.
