CVE-2022-41328
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 6.75%

updated 2023-03-22T05:03:58

2 posts

A improper limitation of a pathname to a restricted directory vulnerability ('path traversal') [CWE-22] in Fortinet FortiOS version 7.2.0 through 7.2.3, 7.0.0 through 7.0.9 and before 6.4.11 allows a privileged attacker to read and write files on the underlying Linux system via crafted CLI commands.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-19T02:12:17.940Z ##

Mandiant: Cloaked and Covert: Uncovering UNC3886 Espionage Operations
Mandiant blogs about the Chinese state-sponsored espionage actor UNC3886. They discuess UNC3886's intrusion path and subsequent actions that were performed in the environments after compromising the guest virtual machines to achieve access to the critical systems, including:

  • The use of publicly available rootkits for long-term persistence
  • Deployment of malware that leveraged trusted third-party services for C2
  • Subverting access and collecting credentials with Secure Shell (SSH) backdoors
  • Extracting credentials from TACACS+ authentication using custom malware

Vulnerabilities exploited by UNC3886 include CVE-2023-34048, CVE-2022-41328, CVE-2022-22948 (surprisingly not in the KEV Catalog cc: @todb) and CVE-2023-20867. The TACACS+ section is really informative and interesting. IOC and Yara rules provided.

#threatintel #UNC3886 #china #cyberespionage #CVE_2022_41328 #CVE_2023_34048 #CVE_2022_22948 #CVE_2023_20867 #IOC #Yara

CVE-2017-11882
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.44%

updated 2023-02-01T05:03:36

4 posts

Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3, Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2, Microsoft Office 2013 Service Pack 1, and Microsoft Office 2016 allow an attacker to run arbitrary code in the context of the current user by failing to properly handle objects in memory, aka "Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-11884.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-13T11:47:16.938Z ##

ASEC: Keylogger Installed Using MS Office Equation Editor Vulnerability (Kimsuky)
AhnLab SEcurity intelligence Center (ASEC) reports that the North Korean state actor Kimsuky exploited CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability to distribute a keylogger. Kimsuky leveraged the vulnerability to run a page with an embedded malicious script with the mshta process. IOC provided.

#Kimsuky #NorthKorea #cyberespionage #CVE_2017_11882 #threatintel #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-12T13:04:25.374Z ##

Cofense: STR RAT â Phishing Malware Baseline
Cofense provides a rather high level overview of STR, a remote access trojan that is written in Java, and first observed in 2020. It receives near-annual updates which is noted by the uptick in its use by others. Cofense talks about its history, infection method, capabilities, and loaders. One of the loaders mentioned leverages CVE-2017-11882 (7.8 high, disclosed 14 November 2017 by Microsoft, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) Microsoft Office Memory Corruption Vulnerability. Cofense does not provide hashes but their IOC consist of C2 addresses (and network/registry run key indicators).

#threatintel #STRrat #malwareanalysis #IOC #CVE_2017_11882

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-13T11:47:16.000Z ##

Kimsuky leveraged the vulnerability to run a page with an embedded malicious script with the mshta process. IOC provided.

(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 1.19%

updated 2023-01-27T05:01:05

4 posts

The vCenter Server contains an information disclosure vulnerability due to improper permission of files. A malicious actor with non-administrative access to the vCenter Server may exploit this issue to gain access to sensitive information.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-19T02:12:17.940Z ##

Mandiant: Cloaked and Covert: Uncovering UNC3886 Espionage Operations
Mandiant blogs about the Chinese state-sponsored espionage actor UNC3886. They discuess UNC3886's intrusion path and subsequent actions that were performed in the environments after compromising the guest virtual machines to achieve access to the critical systems, including:

  • The use of publicly available rootkits for long-term persistence
  • Deployment of malware that leveraged trusted third-party services for C2
  • Subverting access and collecting credentials with Secure Shell (SSH) backdoors
  • Extracting credentials from TACACS+ authentication using custom malware

Vulnerabilities exploited by UNC3886 include CVE-2023-34048, CVE-2022-41328, CVE-2022-22948 (surprisingly not in the KEV Catalog cc: @todb) and CVE-2023-20867. The TACACS+ section is really informative and interesting. IOC and Yara rules provided.

CVE-2022-26500
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 3.43%

updated 2023-01-27T05:00:45

1 posts

Improper limitation of path names in Veeam Backup & Replication 9.5U3, 9.5U4,10.x, and 11.x allows remote authenticated users access to internal API functions that allows attackers to upload and execute arbitrary code.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-10T18:40:41.000Z ##

Summoning Team: Bypassing Veeam Authentication CVE-2024-29849
Summoning Team has a full analysis and proof of concept exploit code for CVE-2024-29849 (9.8 critical, disclosed 21 May 2024 by Veeam) authentication bypass in Veeam Backup & Replication.

Why you should worry about CVE-2024-29849:
Veeam Backup & Replication has three exploited vulnerabilities that made it to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2023-27532 (7.5 high) Missing Authentication: disclosed 10 March 2023, added 22 August 2023 (5 months)
  • CVE-2022-26501 (9.8 critical) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)
  • CVE-2022-26500 (8.8 high) RCE: disclosed 12 March 2022, added 13 December 2022 (9 months)

All three of these were known to be used in ransomware campaigns.

#CVE_2024_29849 #Veeam #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #PoC

CVE-2024-0044
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

7 posts

2 repos

https://github.com/scs-labrat/android_autorooter

https://github.com/pl4int3xt/cve_2024_0044

DarkWebInformer at 2024-06-19T17:47:40.277Z ##

ð¨POC RELEASEDð¨CVE-2024-0044: a "run-as any app" high-severity vulnerability affecting Android versions 12 and 13ð

"CVE-2024-0044, identified in the createSessionInternal function of the PackageInstallerService[.]java file, is a high-severity vulnerability affecting Android versions 12 and 13.

This vulnerability allows an attacker to perform a "run-as any app" attack, leading to local escalation of privilege without requiring user interaction. The issue arises due to improper input validation within the createSessionInternal function.

An attacker can exploit this by manipulating the session creation process, potentially gaining unauthorized access to sensitive data and performing unauthorized actions on the affected deviceâ"

https://github.com/pl4int3xt/cve_2024_0044

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1803484475298377961

CVE-2023-37079
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-19T03:00:40.920Z ##

VMware security advisory disclosed 17 June 2024: VMSA-2024-0012:VMware vCenter Server updates address heap-overflow and privilege escalation vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-37079, CVE-2024-37080, CVE-2024-37081)

  • CVE-2024-37079 and CVE-2024-37080 (9.8 critical) heap-overflow vulnerability (sending a specially crafted network packet potentially leading to remote code execution)
  • CVE-2024-37081 (7.8 high) privilege escalation vulnerability (elevate privileges to root on vCenter Server Appliance)

No mention of exploitation. Fuck Broadcom though for making these security advisories harder to find and no public RSS feeds for it.

#VMware #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_37079 #CVE_2024_37080 #CVE_2024_37081

  • CVE-2024-37081 (7.8 high) privilege escalation vulnerability (elevate privileges to root on vCenter Server Appliance)

harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-09T12:21:26.000Z ##

@chainq @68000 We also release hotfix updates to our "openssl3.library" as needed. However none of the recent vulnerabilities (including CVE-2024-4741 and CVE-2024-4603) warranted a hotfix release as these issues can only occur if a local application uses the affected functionalities. Any security updates to MorphOS openssl3.library are announced at https://www.morphos-team.net/news and https://morph.zone/news/

screaminggoat at 2024-06-14T13:30:46.421Z ##

Volexity: DISGOMOJI Malware Used to Target Indian Government
Volexity identified a 2024 cyber-espionage campaign undertaken by a suspected Pakistan-based threat they track as UTA0137. Volexity assesses with high confidence that UTA0137 conducts cyber espionage against Indian government targets. Volexity describes a Linux malware dubbed DISGOMOJI, written in Golang, using Discord for C2 and emojis for C2 communication ðð¥ð¥. Based on the use of Linux malware for initial access, Volexity assesses that the campaign is targeted towards Indian government entities who use a custom Linux distro named BOSS as their daily desktop. Volexity also uncovered UTA0137âs leveraging of of CVE-2022-0847 (7.8 high, disclosed 10 March 2022, added to KEV Catalog 25 April 2022) Linux EoP nicknamed "DirtyPipe" against "BOSS 9" systems. This blog post includes analysis of the DISGOMOJI malware; details of attacker tradecraft, including the UTA0137âs use of third-party storage services used to exfiltrate data; Linux persistence techniques; and open-source tools used after successful infection.

#cyberespionage #UTA0137 #Pakistan #India #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2022_0847 #DISGOMOJI #DirtyPipe

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-14T13:30:46.000Z ##

Volexity: DISGOMOJI Malware Used to Target Indian Government
Volexity identified a 2024 cyber-espionage campaign undertaken by a suspected Pakistan-based threat they track as UTA0137. Volexity assesses with high confidence that UTA0137 conducts cyber espionage against Indian government targets. Volexity describes a Linux malware dubbed DISGOMOJI, written in Golang, using Discord for C2 and emojis for C2 communication ðð¥ð¥. Based on the use of Linux malware for initial access, Volexity assesses that the campaign is targeted towards Indian government entities who use a custom Linux distro named BOSS as their daily desktop. Volexity also uncovered UTA0137âs leveraging of of CVE-2022-0847 (7.8 high, disclosed 10 March 2022, added to KEV Catalog 25 April 2022) Linux EoP nicknamed "DirtyPipe" against "BOSS 9" systems. This blog post includes analysis of the DISGOMOJI malware; details of attacker tradecraft, including the UTA0137âs use of third-party storage services used to exfiltrate data; Linux persistence techniques; and open-source tools used after successful infection.

CVE-2024-3943
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

N/A

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T13:10:55.000Z ##

Kaspersky: QR code SQL injection and other vulnerabilities in a popular biometric terminal
Biometric scanners have their own sorts of vulnerabilities, and Kaspersky gives us a rundown: overview of biometric terminals, their pros and cons, physical inspection and reverse engineering of a specific terminal (including network and camera/QR code scanning analysis), and identifying its vulnerabilities. Their analysis of the ZKTeco biometric terminal yielded 24 vulnerabilities:

  • 6 SQL injection vulnerabilities;
  • 7 buffer stack overflow vulnerabilities;
  • 5 command injection vulnerabilities;
  • 4 arbitrary file write vulnerabilities;
  • 2 arbitrary file read vulnerabilities.

These vulnerability types are reflected in CVEs ranging from CVE-2024-3938 through CVE-2024-3943.

#vulnerability #biometric #cve

##

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-11T13:10:55.000Z ##

Kaspersky: QR code SQL injection and other vulnerabilities in a popular biometric terminal
Biometric scanners have their own sorts of vulnerabilities, and Kaspersky gives us a rundown: overview of biometric terminals, their pros and cons, physical inspection and reverse engineering of a specific terminal (including network and camera/QR code scanning analysis), and identifying its vulnerabilities. Their analysis of the ZKTeco biometric terminal yielded 24 vulnerabilities:

  • 6 SQL injection vulnerabilities;
  • 7 buffer stack overflow vulnerabilities;
  • 5 command injection vulnerabilities;
  • 4 arbitrary file write vulnerabilities;
  • 2 arbitrary file read vulnerabilities.

These vulnerability types are reflected in CVEs ranging from CVE-2024-3938 through CVE-2024-3943.
